analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Vajrasattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Having paid homage to the Tathāgata,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi de nyid che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi de nyid che //
translated: The great suchness of all buddhas,

original: bsdus pa rtogs pa dge ba ni //
analyzed: bsdus pa rtogs pa dge ba ni //
translated: The virtuous realization of the compendium

original: ci nus par ni rnam par dbye //
analyzed: ci nus par ni rnam par dbye //
translated: Will be analyzed to the best of my ability.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the subject matter and the connection of this text beginning with the words thus have I heard?

original: de bzhin du dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa ni ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa ni ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Similarly, what is the purpose and the purpose of the purpose?

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be stated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyud yin la /🔽'di'i 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la @2a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyud yin la / 'di'i 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la @2a * //
translated: This text called the Compendium of Principles of All Tathāgatas, Mahāyāna-abhisamaya, is a tantra.

original: sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i bdag nyid bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ston par byed pa'i gling gzhi'i mdo ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i mtshan nyid du bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin la
analyzed: sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i bdag nyid bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ston par byed pa'i gling gzhi'i mdo ni rnam par snang mdzad dang rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i mtshan nyid du bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin la
translated: This text beginning with the words thus have I heard is the foundation chapter of the tantra that teaches the perfect fulfillment of the aims of self and other, which is the nature of Vairocana and Mahāvairocana.

original: gdul bya rnams mngon par 'dod pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams mngon par 'dod pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is stated in order to generate the desire to be subdued.

original: gdul bya rnams mngon par 'dod pa rnams la rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i rang bzhin mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams mngon par 'dod pa rnams la rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i rang bzhin mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make the nature of Vairocana and Mahāvairocana manifest to those who are to be subdued,

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: then, beginning with “the buddha-field of all the tathāgatas here,”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas zhes bya ba'i bar gyis thabs dang de'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byed pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas zhes bya ba'i bar gyis thabs dang de'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byed pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to “the Blessed One having spoken thus,” the method and its nature are taught.

original: de la thabs kyi dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la thabs kyi dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: There, the division of the method should be explained.

original: de la yang ting nge 'dzin nyid ni dngos su thabs yin pas na /
analyzed: de la yang ting nge 'dzin nyid ni dngos su thabs yin pas na /
translated: Moreover, since samādhi itself is the actual method,

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: then, beginning with “the buddha-field of all the tathāgatas here,”

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni gcig tu gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni gcig tu gyur //
translated: the buddhas become one.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas ni dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog dang / las @2b kyi rgyal po mchog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas ni dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog dang / las @2b kyi rgyal po mchog ste /
translated: The explanation up to “thus” is the first application.🔽🔽The supreme king of maṇḍalas and the supreme king of activities are the second application.🔽

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum bstan pa yin no //
translated: The explanation up to “thus it is said” teaches the three samadhis: the first yoga, the supreme king of mandalas, and the supreme king of actions.

original: dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams kyis thabs de la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams kyis thabs de la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Those who have obtained the commitments and initiation should enter into that method.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of this, the text from “Then the bhagavat, all tathagatas…” up to🔽“…the one whose name is uttered, there is the utterance of ‘hey you.’”

original: gang gi ming brjod pa der kye zhes brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ni slob dpon gyi las rnams dang / dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa'i chog rgyas par bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ming brjod pa der kye zhes brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ni slob dpon gyi las rnams dang / dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa'i chog rgyas par bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This passage extensively teaches the activities of the master and the rite of entering all mandalas.

original: dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa de rnams nyid la slob dpon gyis ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi ye shes bshad par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa de rnams nyid la slob dpon gyis ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi ye shes bshad par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the master should explain the gnosis of the powers that are desired by those who have obtained the pledges and initiation,

original: de nas ci khyod don 'byung ba'i dngos grub kyi ye shes dang rdzu 'phrul gyi dngos grub kyi ye shes dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas ci khyod don 'byung ba'i dngos grub kyi ye shes dang rdzu 'phrul gyi dngos grub kyi ye shes dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then, do you desire the gnosis of the power of the accomplishment of the goal, the gnosis of the power of the accomplishment of magical powers, and so forth, up to the gnosis of the power of the accomplishment of the state of Vajradhara?”

original: badzra a'a ha ra zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dngos grub kyi ye shes kyi rgyud gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: badzra a'a ha ra zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dngos grub kyi ye shes kyi rgyud gsungs pa yin no //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares the tantra of the gnosis of the power of the accomplishment of the goal, and so forth, up to “vajra āhara.”

original: don grub pa la sogs pa yang sgrub pa pos bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pas rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor bskyed la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa po spro ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir phan yon brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don grub pa la sogs pa yang sgrub pa pos bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pas rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor bskyed la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa po spro ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir phan yon brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares that the practitioner should generate the yoga of his deity through the consecration of himself and so forth, and should accomplish the goal of the accomplishment of the state of Vajradhara, and so forth, and in order to encourage the practitioner, [the Bhagavān] declares the benefits.

original: de nas rang gi rigs kyi lha'i snying po byin la phyag rgya bzhi'i ye shes bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas rang gi rigs kyi lha'i snying po byin la phyag rgya bzhi'i ye shes bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, having given the essence mantra of one's own clan deity, one should teach the exalted wisdom of the four seals, beginning with

original: rdo rje dril bu bskyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu bskyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: shaking the vajra and bell.

original: dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos bcings pa'i cho ga sngon du 'gro bas bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen pos bcings pa'i cho ga sngon du 'gro bas bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of having gone before with the rite of binding with the pledge, doctrine, action, and great seals is to be explained.🔽 Therefore, beginning with

original: de nas phyag rgya thams cad kyi spyi'i phyag rgya bcing ba'i cho ga rgyas par bshad de zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya thams cad kyi spyi'i phyag rgya bcing ba'i cho ga rgyas par bshad de zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: the explanation of the extensive rite of binding all the seals in general, up to

original: de nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: then one should accomplish.

original: de bsgrub par bya ba'i cho ga rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
analyzed: de bsgrub par bya ba'i cho ga rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: The extensive rite of accomplishing that is as follows, the text explains.

original: cho ga ji lta bas rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la mdun rdo rje dbab pa yang dag par bskyed de /
analyzed: cho ga ji lta bas rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la mdun rdo rje dbab pa yang dag par bskyed de /
translated: Having bound the great seal of one's own deity with the rite as it is, one should generate the vajra in front.

original: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po'i nga rgyal rnam par bsgoms nas phyag rgya de yang rang gi lha'i skur bsams la /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po'i nga rgyal rnam par bsgoms nas phyag rgya de yang rang gi lha'i skur bsams la /
translated: Having cultivated the pride of the great seal of one's deity, one should imagine that seal as the body of one's deity.

original: de las rang gi lha'i nga rgyal bskyed la ye shes sems dpa' rang gi lus la ji lta ba bzhin du bcug ste /🔽phyag rgya chen po rab tu sgrub pa dang / bdag la byin @3a * //
analyzed: de las rang gi lha'i nga rgyal bskyed la ye shes sems dpa' rang gi lus la ji lta ba bzhin du bcug ste / phyag rgya chen po rab tu sgrub pa dang / bdag la byin @3a * //
translated: From that, one should generate the pride of one's deity and cause the gnosis being to enter one's body just as before.

original: gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas nas rab tu shis pa'i sgra brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas don sgrub pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas nas rab tu shis pa'i sgra brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas don sgrub pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having performed the great seal practice, the self-consecration, and so forth, one should recite the mantra vajra-nidhi and so forth, preceded by the utterance of the auspicious sound, in order to accomplish the aims of establishing the attainment of siddhis and so forth.

original: badzra ni dhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: badzra ni dhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of that, it is said:🔽Then, the extensive ritual of siddhi is explained...

original: de nas dngos grub kyi cho ga rgyas par bshad de zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub kyi cho ga rgyas par bshad de zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: up to:

original: dngos grub kyi cho ga rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi cho ga rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: This is the extensive ritual of siddhi.

original: bzlas brjod dang sgom pa dang rab tu ldan zhing sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pas rdo rje sems dpa' brtan par gyur nas /
analyzed: bzlas brjod dang sgom pa dang rab tu ldan zhing sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pas rdo rje sems dpa' brtan par gyur nas /
translated: Having become firm Vajrasattva through recitation, meditation, and being endowed with the abandonment of all obscurations,

original: sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to stabilize the mind,

original: de nas phyag rgya thams cad kyi spyi'i lus dang ngag dang sems rdo rjer bya ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya thams cad kyi spyi'i lus dang ngag dang sems rdo rjer bya ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: then, beginning with “the general body, speech, and mind vajra of all the mudras,”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis cho ga bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis cho ga bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to “Vajrasattva, the Tathāgata, has spoken,” the text teaches the ritual.

original: bzlas brod dang bsgom pas sems dub na thun mtshams re re phyag rgya dgrol ba'i cho ga rjes su spyad la lha gshegs su gsol bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzlas brod dang bsgom pas sems dub na thun mtshams re re phyag rgya dgrol ba'i cho ga rjes su spyad la lha gshegs su gsol bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If one is tired of recitation and meditation, at the end of each session one should perform the ritual for releasing the mudra and request the deity to depart. In order to teach this meaning,

original: de nas phyag rgya thams cad kyi dgrol ba spyi'i cho ga bshad do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya thams cad kyi dgrol ba spyi'i cho ga bshad do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning with “then the general ritual for releasing all the mudras,”🔽up to

original: bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang pos gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis cho ga bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang pos gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis cho ga bstan to //
translated: The passage from the Blessed One Samantabhadra up to has taught indicates the ritual.

original: rgyud 'di ni bsgom pa gtso bor gyur pa yin pas 'dir bsgom pa nyid la 'bad par bya'i grangs kyi bzlas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyud 'di ni bsgom pa gtso bor gyur pa yin pas 'dir bsgom pa nyid la 'bad par bya'i grangs kyi bzlas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since this tantra is primarily about meditation, the meaning of this passage is that one should strive in meditation here, not in the recitation of the number of mantras. In order to teach this meaning, the text says:

original: rdo rje sems sogs sems dpa' rnams //
analyzed: rdo rje sems sogs sems dpa' rnams //
translated: The heroes such as Vajrasattva,

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: up to will attain siddhi.

original: dngos grub 'thob ces bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ni 'di'i ci 'dod pa'i bzlas pa'i cho ga ston to //
analyzed: dngos grub 'thob ces bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ni 'di'i ci 'dod pa'i bzlas pa'i cho ga ston to //
translated: The passage from here up to will attain siddhi teaches the mantra recitation ritual as desired.

original: bya ba dang spyod pa dang gnyis ka'i rgyud la sogs pa'i cho ga la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis kyang cho ga des 'di las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba dang spyod pa dang gnyis ka'i rgyud la sogs pa'i cho ga la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis kyang cho ga des 'di las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of even those who are attached to the rituals of the Kriya, Charya, and Yoga tantras and so on should accomplish the great seal and so forth explained in this tantra through that ritual, the text says:

original: snying po phyag rgya sngags rig rnams //
analyzed: snying po phyag rgya sngags rig rnams //
translated: The essence, seal, and knowledge of mantra🔽 are the supreme of all.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: As one wishes.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis ston to //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with “just as one wishes.”

original: sngon du bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i dus dang dkyil 'khor gyi dus su bzlas brjod dang bsgom pas dub par gyur nas lha gshegs su gsol bar 'dod na /
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i dus dang dkyil 'khor gyi dus su bzlas brjod dang bsgom pas dub par gyur nas lha gshegs su gsol bar 'dod na /
translated: If, having become weary through recitation and meditation at the time of prior service and so on and at the time of the maṇḍala, one wishes to dismiss the deity,

original: yang gsang ba'i mchod pa @3b la sogs pa'i mchod pa thams cad kyis lha rnams mchod par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gsang ba'i mchod pa @3b la sogs pa'i mchod pa thams cad kyis lha rnams mchod par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: one should worship the deities with all the offerings, such as the secret offering.

original: de nas gsang ba'i mchod pa brjod cing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i mchod pa brjod cing zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In order to teach this, the text from “Then, having uttered the secret offering” up to

original: mchod pa byed du bcug la zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
analyzed: mchod pa byed du bcug la zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
translated: “having caused the offering to be made” is presented.

original: brtul zhugs yongs su bsrung bas mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob par 'dod pas dngos po 'di nyams su blang ba ni /
analyzed: brtul zhugs yongs su bsrung bas mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob par 'dod pas dngos po 'di nyams su blang ba ni /
translated: One who wishes to attain the desired power through the protection of the vow should practice this rite.

original: ji ltar zhugs pa rnams ci 'byor pa'i ro dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhugs pa rnams ci 'byor pa'i ro dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: “Having begun with the food of whatever is available, such as meat,” up to🔽“having made the offering to the deities,”

original: mna'i snying po yang bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
analyzed: mna'i snying po yang bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
translated: The meaning of the words of the root text is as follows:

original: dkyil 'khor dang sngon du bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i dus su lha rnams mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod la phyag rgya dgrol ba'i cho ga rjes su spyad la gshegs su gsol bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang sngon du bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i dus su lha rnams mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod la phyag rgya dgrol ba'i cho ga rjes su spyad la gshegs su gsol bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: At the time of the mandala and the preliminary approximation, and so on, one should make offerings to the deities with all the offerings, perform the rite of releasing the seals, and request their departure.

original: de nas ji ltar zhugs pa rnams slar bkye ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas ji ltar zhugs pa rnams slar bkye ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of that, the text from “Then, having released those who have entered” up to

analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor thams cad la bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis bstan to //
translated: “One should do this for all mandalas” is taught.🔽In order to teach the meaning of “One should release the four seals of one’s own with one’s own pledge seal, and one should do this in accordance with one’s own place,”

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar gyis rang gi phyag rgya bzhi po dgrol ba ni rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar gyis rang gi phyag rgya bzhi po dgrol ba ni rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the Bhagavān Vairocana up to Vajra Acala release their own four seals.

original: phyag rgya rnams dgrol bar bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya rnams dgrol bar bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has said, The seals should be released.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the gathering of the Great Mandala of the Vajra Realm has been explained.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bsdus pa'i don bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bsdus pa'i don bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now the meaning of the gathering of the Dhāraṇī Mandala, which is primarily the samaya seals, will be explained.

original: de la dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa yin no //
translated: There, the first samādhi is explained in the Great Mandala of the Vajra Realm.

original: 'dir ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is together with Vajrasattva.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, beginning with Again, the Blessed One...,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi grva rnams su dgod do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi grva rnams su dgod do //
translated: up to should be placed in the corners of the mandala.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ni dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ni dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the supreme mandala king samādhi.

original: de nas byin gyis brlabs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas byin gyis brlabs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, beginning with Then, the consecration...,

original: las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa ni 'dir rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa ni 'dir rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The third concentration, called “the supreme king of actions,” should be understood here as being like the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm.

original: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bsgrub @4a * //🔽par bya ba'i phyir gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas yang phyag na rdo rje gsang ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bsgrub @4a * // par bya ba'i phyir gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas yang phyag na rdo rje gsang ba zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In order to accomplish the great seal, etc.,🔽which are explained in the retention maṇḍala, one should obtain the consecration of the sacred commitment in the retention maṇḍala.🔽The meaning of this is taught by the text beginning with “Then again, Vajrapāṇi” and ending with “the knowledge of the secret vajra seal.”

original: rdo rje gsang ba'i phyag rgya'i ye shes bslab po zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ni slob dpon gyi las rnams dang / gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i chog rgyas pa bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje gsang ba'i phyag rgya'i ye shes bslab po zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ni slob dpon gyi las rnams dang / gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i chog rgyas pa bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This passage teaches the extensive ritual for entering the retention maṇḍala and the activities of the master.

original: dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa de rnams la slob dpon gyis ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dngos grub bstan par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la dang por rdo rje gsang ba'i lus kyi phyag rgya'i ye shes bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pa de rnams la slob dpon gyis ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dngos grub bstan par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la dang por rdo rje gsang ba'i lus kyi phyag rgya'i ye shes bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: For those who have obtained the sacred commitments and empowerment, the master should teach the feats of the retention mandala as desired.

original: badzra guhya sa ma ya ham zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
analyzed: badzra guhya sa ma ya ham zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, the text from “First, one should train in the pristine awareness of the body seal of the vajra secret” up to “vajra guhya samaya ham” teaches that.

original: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i dngos grub rnams kyang rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las gsungs pa'i phyag rgya bzhis rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor ji lta ba bzhin du byas te 'di las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa cho ga ji
analyzed: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i dngos grub rnams kyang rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las gsungs pa'i phyag rgya bzhis rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor ji lta ba bzhin du byas te 'di las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa cho ga ji
translated: In order to demonstrate that the feats explained in the retention mandala are also accomplished by the practitioner who has performed the yoga of his deity with the four seals taught in the Great Vajradhātu Maṇḍala and has bound the great seal and so forth explained in this [retention] maṇḍala in accordance with the rite,

original: lta ba bzhin du bcings la sgrub pa pos bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lta ba bzhin du bcings la sgrub pa pos bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the text from “One should perform the rite of accomplishing the feats” up to “vajra guhya samaya ham” teaches that.

original: de nas rdo rje gsang ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings pa bslab bo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gsang ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings pa bslab bo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: up to:

original: dam tshig mchog ni ji snyed pa //
analyzed: dam tshig mchog ni ji snyed pa //
translated: All the supreme commitments

original: gnyis su phral nas de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis su phral nas de bzhin no //
translated: are likewise divided into two.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
translated: This is taught by the treatise.

original: gsang ba'i dam tshig las byung ba'i las kyi phyag rgya rnams sa ma ya satvam zhes brjod cing sgrub pa pos bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor du bcing bar bya'i /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dam tshig las byung ba'i las kyi phyag rgya rnams sa ma ya satvam zhes brjod cing sgrub pa pos bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor du bcing bar bya'i /
translated: The action seals that arise from the secret commitments should be bound in the accomplishment maṇḍala by the practitioner who recites samaya stvaṃ,🔽but not at other times.

original: dus gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this meaning,

original: de nas 'di rnams bsgrub pa bshad //
analyzed: de nas 'di rnams bsgrub pa bshad //
translated: then, the accomplishment of these is explained,🔽and so on,

original: ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: up to:

original: rtag pa'i bdag pos gtang nga re //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag pos gtang nga re //
translated: The lord of permanence should be released.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
translated: This is taught by the treatise.

original: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po thams cad badzra h'um bandha zhes bya bas bcing bar bya zhing rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas rang gi gnas su nges par grol ba ni /🔽badzra mu: zhes pas bya'o //🔽phyag rgya de thams cad rdo rje rin chen gyis snga ma bzhin du dbang bskur bar @4b bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po thams cad badzra h'um bandha zhes bya bas bcing bar bya zhing rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas rang gi gnas su nges par grol ba ni / badzra mu: zhes pas bya'o // phyag rgya de thams cad rdo rje rin chen gyis snga ma bzhin du dbang bskur bar @4b bya ba ni /
translated: Bind all the pledges, doctrines, actions, and great seals taught in the maṇḍala of retention with “vajra-huṃ-bandha,” and release them in their own places with the pledge seal of one’s deity with “vajra-muḥ.”

analyzed: aom dri dha badzra ka ba tsadhri ka ces bya bas so //
translated: Empower all those seals with the vajra jewel, as before, with “oṃ dṛḍha vajra-kavaca-dhṛk.”

original: de bzhin du de rnams kyi go cha bcing bar byas la aom badzra guhya sa ma ya ta la sa zhes bya bas de rnams mnyam pa'i thal mo gsum gyis mnyes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du de rnams kyi go cha bcing bar byas la aom badzra guhya sa ma ya ta la sa zhes bya bas de rnams mnyam pa'i thal mo gsum gyis mnyes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de nas phyag rgya 'di rnams bcing pa la sgas pa'i las rnams yin no zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: aom guhya sa ma ya ta la sa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
translated: The text from “Oṃ guhya-sa-mā-ya ta-la-sa” teaches the meaning of the mantra.

original: gang zhig phyag rgya chen po la sogs pas 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pas de ni bcing ba la sogs pa'i las rnams badzra sa tva zhes bya ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rdo rje phra mo'i ye shes kyi dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

original: / zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis rtog pa thams cad kyi ye shes skyed pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i rgyud ston to //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis rtog pa thams cad kyi ye shes skyed pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i rgyud ston to //
translated: teaches the extensive tantra of the rite for generating the knowledge of all the families.

original: de nyid kyis na gdul bya de rnams rtog pa sna tshogs kyis nye bar bcom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gdul bya de rnams rtog pa sna tshogs kyis nye bar bcom pa'i phyir /
translated: Since those disciples are destroyed by various thoughts,

original: lta ba ngan pa dang zhen pa dang ma bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa dang zhen pa dang ma bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pas /
translated: they are not free from bad views and attachment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi zlos pa pos thun mong dang khyad par gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i phyag rgya bsgrub pa nyams su blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi zlos pa pos thun mong dang khyad par gyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i phyag rgya bsgrub pa nyams su blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand this meaning,

original: de nas rigs thams cad kyi thun mong ba'i zhes bya ba nas /🔽@26b rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rigs thams cad kyi gsang ba'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i phyag rgya'i rgyud ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas rigs thams cad kyi thun mong ba'i zhes bya ba nas / @26b rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rigs thams cad kyi gsang ba'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i phyag rgya'i rgyud ston pa yin no //
translated: from then, the common of all the families up to🔽Vajrasattva has spoken teaches the tantra of the secret vajra seals of body, speech, and mind of all the families.

original: rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyud phyi ma'i phyi ma'i bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyud phyi ma'i phyi ma'i bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the summarized meaning of the Continuation of the Continuation of the Tantra of All the Mandalas.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor du slob ma bcug nas dbang bskur ba thams cad kyis dbang bskur nas /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor du slob ma bcug nas dbang bskur ba thams cad kyis dbang bskur nas /
translated: Having initiated the disciples into the mandala as taught, having conferred all the initiations,

original: lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gshegs su gsol ba byas la /
analyzed: lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gshegs su gsol ba byas la /
translated: and having requested the deities to depart as they came,

original: sprul pa rnams rang gi lus su bcug ste mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i rang gi thugs ka na gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' la mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas yang dag par bstod nas ci ltar bde ba'i spyod lam gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: sprul pa rnams rang gi lus su bcug ste mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i rang gi thugs ka na gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' la mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas yang dag par bstod nas ci ltar bde ba'i spyod lam gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i
translated: Having caused the emanations to enter one’s body, one should abide in whatever posture is comfortable, having thoroughly praised Vajrasattva residing in one’s heart with the one hundred and eight names, and having manifestly and completely awakened.

original: don 'di bstan par bya'i ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di bstan par bya'i ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this meaning,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje stan las langs nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje stan las langs nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: the text from “Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi arose from his seat” up to

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i theg pa chen po mngon par bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i theg pa chen po mngon par bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis ston to //
translated: “the Great Vehicle of the Secret of All Tathāgatas” is taught by the text.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i bsdus pa'i don thams cad bstan pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad dang rnam par snang mdzad chen por gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni brjod par bya ba bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i bsdus pa'i don thams cad bstan pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad dang rnam par snang mdzad chen por gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni brjod par bya ba bshad pa yin la /
translated: The explanation of the subject matter is the nature of the Bhagavat Sakyamuni as Vairocana and Mahāvairocana, which is the teaching of all the topics of the summary as they have been explained.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rgyud yin no //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rgyud yin no //
translated: The collection of words that teach that is the tantra.

original: rgyud dang brjod par bya ba gnyis kyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid du 'brel pa ni 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud dang brjod par bya ba gnyis kyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid du 'brel pa ni 'brel ba'o //
translated: The connection is the relationship of the expressed and the expresser between the two, the tantra and the subject matter.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po brjod par bya ba bstan pas gdul bya rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa skyed pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po brjod par bya ba bstan pas gdul bya rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa skyed pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is the generation of the desire of the disciples by the teaching of the subject matter, Vairocana and Mahāvairocana, who are the method and wisdom.

original: mngon par 'dod pa skyed pa de rnams dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas de'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byed pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no ;
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa skyed pa de rnams dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas de'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byed pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no ;
translated: The supramundane purpose is the direct realization of that nature by means of entering the mandala and so forth of those who have generated the desire.

original: / rgyud 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //🔽de la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra @27a * //
analyzed: / rgyud 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so // de la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra @27a * //
translated: This tantra is called the Great Vehicle of the Compendium of Principles of All Tathāgatas.🔽In this, the nondual mind and mental factors of all the blessed buddhas of the past, present, and future, equal to the particles of all world systems,

original: rab dang mnyam pa rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gnyis su med de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: rab dang mnyam pa rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gnyis su med de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: are nondual, and are all the tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: Their reality is tenfold.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya dang bdag dang gnas la sogs pa bsrung pa dang / lha rnams spyan drang ba'i cho ga dang / bzlas brjod dang sgom pa dang / phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi sbyin sreg dang nye bar bsdu ba dang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya dang bdag dang gnas la sogs pa bsrung pa dang / lha rnams spyan drang ba'i cho ga dang / bzlas brjod dang sgom pa dang / phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi sbyin sreg dang nye bar bsdu ba dang /
translated: the inner and outer nature of the fire offering, and the conclusion,

original: mchod nas gshegs su gsol ba'o //
analyzed: mchod nas gshegs su gsol ba'o //
translated: having made offerings, one should request their departure.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gyi grangs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gyi grangs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the number of maṇḍalas should be stated.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dum bu la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ni bcu'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dum bu la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ni bcu'o //
translated: In the Vajradhātu section, there are ten maṇḍalas of the Tathāgata family.

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i dum bu la rdo rje'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ni bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i dum bu la rdo rje'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor ni bcu bzhi'o //
translated: In the section of the Trailokyavijaya, there are fourteen maṇḍalas of the Vajra family.

original: padma'i rigs dang nor bu'i rigs gnyis la yang grangs de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs dang nor bu'i rigs gnyis la yang grangs de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the two families of Padma and Jewel, the number is the same as in the Tathāgata family.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rgyud phyi ma la sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rgyud phyi ma la sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: Moreover, in the Tathāgata family's sequel tantra, there are thirty-seven maṇḍalas for practice.

original: rdo rje'i rigs la lnga rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs la lnga rtsa brgyad do //
translated: The Vajra family has five, and eight root downfalls.

original: padma'i rigs dang nor bu'i rigs gnyis la yang grangs de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs dang nor bu'i rigs gnyis la yang grangs de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: The Lotus family and the Jewel family have the same number of downfalls as the Tathāgata family.

original: sngags la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni 'di'i rgyud phyi ma'i bshad pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni 'di'i rgyud phyi ma'i bshad pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The reality of mantra and so on should be understood from the commentary on the continuation of this tantra.

original: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu dang don dam pa'i de kho na nyid las bcu por gyur pa /🔽de kho na nyid bcu po de dag nyid thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye bas de kho na nyid bcu po de dag nyid rnam pa gnyis su 'jog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu dang don dam pa'i de kho na nyid las bcu por gyur pa / de kho na nyid bcu po de dag nyid thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye bas de kho na nyid bcu po de dag nyid rnam pa gnyis su 'jog pa yang yin no //
translated: Or else, the ten are from the reality of cause, effect, and the ultimate.🔽Those ten realities are also posited as two kinds, by the division of the perfections of wisdom and method of hearing and contemplating.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bcu po de dag nyid thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab gnyis kyis yang dag par bzung pas na bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bcu po de dag nyid thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab gnyis kyis yang dag par bzung pas na bsdus pa'o //
translated: Those ten realities, as they have been explained, are subsumed by the two, the perfections of wisdom and method, because they are correctly apprehended by the two, the wisdoms of hearing and contemplating.

original: de nyid ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: That itself is the Great Vehicle.

original: de khong du chud pa ni mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de khong du chud pa ni mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The understanding of that is the clear realization,

original: mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: which is the direct realization.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs nyi rgyud ces bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs nyi rgyud ces bya bar bshad do //
translated: The collection of words that teaches that is explained as the Tantra of the Compendium of Principles.

original: yang rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po bstan pa ni gleng @27b gzhi'o //
analyzed: yang rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po bstan pa ni gleng @27b gzhi'o //
translated: The teaching of Vairocana and Great Vairocana is the nidāna.

original: 'di nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa lnga nas brtsams te dum bu bzhir bstan pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud do //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa lnga nas brtsams te dum bu bzhir bstan pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud do //
translated: The teaching of the root tantra is the four chapters beginning with the five manifest enlightenments.

original: yang 'di'i mchog gi dngos grub kyi khyad par brjod pa ni rgyud phyi ma'o //
analyzed: yang 'di'i mchog gi dngos grub kyi khyad par brjod pa ni rgyud phyi ma'o //
translated: The teaching of the sequel tantra is the statement of the features of the supreme feat.

original: gzhan yang mchog gi dngos bsgrub pa'i khyad par la 'jug mi nus pa la dmigs pa dang bcas par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rgyud phyi ma'i phyi ma bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mchog gi dngos bsgrub pa'i khyad par la 'jug mi nus pa la dmigs pa dang bcas par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rgyud phyi ma'i phyi ma bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the sequel to the sequel tantra is for those who are unable to engage in the features of the supreme feat and is for those who are conceptual and have a focus.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa'i mdo'i bsdus pa'i don bstan pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa'i mdo'i bsdus pa'i don bstan pa rdzogs so /
translated: The teaching of the summarized meaning of the Great Vehicle Utterance of Realization, the Compendium of Principles of All Ones Gone Thus, is complete.

original: // / de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa'i mdo blo la gnas par byas nas /
analyzed: // / de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid bsdus pa theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa'i mdo blo la gnas par byas nas /
translated: Having caused the Great Vehicle Utterance of Realization, the Compendium of Principles of All Ones Gone Thus, to abide in the mind in that way,

original: sdud par byed pas sa bcu'i dbang phyug lcang lo can gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pas 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
analyzed: sdud par byed pas sa bcu'i dbang phyug lcang lo can gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pas 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin te /
translated: the compiler Vajradhara, lord of the tenth stage, residing in the palace of Alakavati, said this and so forth.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i yang dag par bsdus pa'i gzhung gi tshul zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i yang dag par bsdus pa'i gzhung gi tshul zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In this regard, this and so forth refers to the method of the text of the just explained correct summary.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yin par ston to //
translated: Myself indicates that it is oneself.

original: bdag nyid kyis thos kyi gzhan dag las brgyud pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis thos kyi gzhan dag las brgyud pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it was heard by oneself and not from another.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pas thos pa yin gyi rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pas thos pa yin gyi rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is called heard means that it is heard by the wisdom that has the nature of hearing, not by realization. This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa dang ma yengs pa nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa dang ma yengs pa nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that he himself heard it directly and was not distracted.

original: khyed kyis de gang gi tshe thos she na /
analyzed: khyed kyis de gang gi tshe thos she na /
translated: When did you hear it?

original: dus gcig ni zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: dus gcig ni zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: He says, at one time.

original: dus gcig ni dus gcig gi tshe ste /
analyzed: dus gcig ni dus gcig gi tshe ste /
translated: At one time means at one time,

original: gzhan dag gi tshe dang gzhan dag kyang bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi tshe dang gzhan dag kyang bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: at another time, and at another time, I heard it.

original: 'dis kyang bdag nyid thos pa mang bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bdag nyid thos pa mang bar ston pa yin no //
translated: This also shows that he himself is very learned.

original: yang na dus gcig na ni skad cig ma gcig nyid la ste /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig na ni skad cig ma gcig nyid la ste /
translated: Or, at one time means in one moment.

original: 'dis kyang rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa thob pa nyid kyis skad cig ma gcig nyid la dus gsum gyi bskal pa so sor snang bas bdag nyid tshad ma'i skyes bu nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa thob pa nyid kyis skad cig ma gcig nyid la dus gsum gyi bskal pa so sor snang bas bdag nyid tshad ma'i skyes bu nyid yin par ston to //
translated: This also shows that he himself is a reliable person because he has attained the inconceivable liberation, and in one moment alone, the three times appear distinctly.

original: khyed kyis gang las gang du thos zhes rtogs pa 'di bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyis gang las gang du thos zhes rtogs pa 'di bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt, “From whom did you hear what?”

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba @28a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba @28a * //
translated: the Bhagavān, etc.

original: la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: is stated.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs te zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs te zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, “the Bhagavān was dwelling in the abode of the king of the gods” should be connected with this.

original: de bas na don 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: de bas na don 'di skad ston te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning that is taught:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavān was dwelling in the abode of the king of the gods of Akaniṣṭha.

original: de las der bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las der bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From there, I heard this.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu dang / phung po dang / 'chi bdag gi mtshan nyid can gyi bdud bzhi bcom pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu dang / phung po dang / 'chi bdag gi mtshan nyid can gyi bdud bzhi bcom pas na /
translated: Since the four māras, which have the characteristics of afflictions, sons of gods, aggregates, and the Lord of Death, were conquered,

original: bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: he is the Bhagavān.

original: khyad par ji lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das 'di las khyed kyis thos she na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das 'di las khyed kyis thos she na /
translated: In what way is this Bhagavān from whom you heard special?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Tathāgata, etc. is stated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis byang chub kyi sems dang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems dang sems
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis byang chub kyi sems dang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems dang sems
translated: The mind and mental factors, which are of the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment and non-duality, of the Buddhas equal to the atoms of all world-realms,

original: las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: las byung ba rnams so //
translated: are blessed.

original: de nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pas bskyod par mi nus pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pas bskyod par mi nus pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: That very [Thought of Enlightenment] is a vajra, since it cannot be shaken by the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: de rnams byin gyis brlabs pa ni sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs so //
analyzed: de rnams byin gyis brlabs pa ni sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs so //
translated: The blessing of those [Buddhas] is the momentum of the former impulsion.

original: de'i dam tshig ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs de las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs de las skyes pa'o //
translated: The commitment of that [vajra] is the birth from that Tathagata family.

original: 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las she na /
translated: From what is that so?🔽It is said:

original: rtag tu dri med thugs rje'i shugs las byung //
analyzed: rtag tu dri med thugs rje'i shugs las byung //
translated: Constantly arising from the power of stainless compassion,

original: smon lam grub pa mi 'gag chos nyid can //
analyzed: smon lam grub pa mi 'gag chos nyid can //
translated: Having the nature of unobstructed accomplishment of vows,

original: 'gro ba'i don sgrub mtha' yas lhur mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don sgrub mtha' yas lhur mdzad pa //
translated: Devoted to the infinite benefit of beings,

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid rtag tu rnam par snang //
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid rtag tu rnam par snang //
translated: The nature of compassion always manifests.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dam tshig de dag gi ye shes ni der nges pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig de dag gi ye shes ni der nges pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of those commitments is ascertained there.

original: de'i rnam pa sna tshogs kyi khyad par ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs par nges pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa sna tshogs kyi khyad par ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs par nges pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The various aspects of that are the nature ascertained as the great seal, etc.

original: de rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa ni bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa ni bcas pa'o //
translated: Endowed with those is the possession.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs thugs su chud pa dang dam tshig mkhyen pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs thugs su chud pa dang dam tshig mkhyen pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows the Lord's realization of the Tathagata lineage and knowledge of the commitments.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang dam tshig shes par bya'o zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang dam tshig shes par bya'o zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It also shows that those who wish to practice the mantra way should know the commitments.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ngo bo nyid du gnyis su med pa'i sems las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ngo bo nyid du gnyis su med pa'i sems las byung ba ste /
translated: The commitments of the Tathagatas are the nondual mind which is the essence of the perfection of generosity.

original: de las byung ba'i rin po che'i dbu rgyan des /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rin po che'i dbu rgyan des /
translated: The jewel crown which arises from that

original: 'dod pa dang @28b gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khams gsum par chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyur dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang @28b gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khams gsum par chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyur dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: He is anointed as the cause of the sovereignty of Dharma in the three realms, which are characterized by the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: des brnyes pa ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la nges par sbyor ba'i chos kyi rgyal srid do //
analyzed: des brnyes pa ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la nges par sbyor ba'i chos kyi rgyal srid do //
translated: His acquisition is the sovereignty of Dharma, which definitely joins all sentient beings who live in the three realms to the supramundane path.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rin po che'i rigs thugs su chud pa dang dbang bskur bar brnyes par yang ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rin po che'i rigs thugs su chud pa dang dbang bskur bar brnyes par yang ston te /
translated: This shows that the Lord has acquired the understanding and the anointment of the jewel lineage.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad par 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang dbang bskur ba thob par bya'o zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad par 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang dbang bskur ba thob par bya'o zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It also shows that those who wish to practice the gateway of mantra should obtain the anointment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the perfection of wisdom and the nondual mind and mental factors.

original: de nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That itself is the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de nyid ni rnal 'byor chen po ste de gang la mnga' ba de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rnal 'byor chen po ste de gang la mnga' ba de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor chen po'o //
translated: He is the great yoga, and he who possesses that is the great yoga of the knowledge of omniscience.

original: de dag kyang yin la dbang phyug kyang yin pas na /
analyzed: de dag kyang yin la dbang phyug kyang yin pas na /
translated: And he is the lord of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug go //
translated: Thus, he is the lord of the great yoga of the knowledge of omniscience of all the Tathagatas.

original: 'dir kyang bcom ldan 'das padma'i rigs thugs su chud pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsnyen bas rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug yin par ston la /
analyzed: 'dir kyang bcom ldan 'das padma'i rigs thugs su chud pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsnyen bas rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug yin par ston la /
translated: Here, the Blessed One is shown to be the lord of the great yoga of the knowledge of omniscience, because he has realized the lotus family and has served the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pas kyang rnal 'byor la dbang du gyur par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pas kyang rnal 'byor la dbang du gyur par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: And it is shown that one who wishes to practice the mantra way should also become a lord of yoga.

original: 'dis ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug brnyes pas de nyid kyi don sum tshogs pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi don kyang mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug brnyes pas de nyid kyi don sum tshogs pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi don kyang mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that just as he has attained the gnosis of omniscience, the lord of great yoga, he also performs the benefit of others in the same way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Thus, the Tathagata,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the nature of the perfection of effort.

original: de nyid ni phyag rgya thams cad de sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub par brtson 'grus kyi gzugs bskyed par rgyas 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni phyag rgya thams cad de sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub par brtson 'grus kyi gzugs bskyed par rgyas 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the seal of all, because it seals all the realms of sentient beings with the form of effort that awakens them.

original: de nyid ni mnyam pa nyid do /
analyzed: de nyid ni mnyam pa nyid do /
translated: That itself is sameness.

original: de thugs su chud pa ni brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: de thugs su chud pa ni brnyes pa'o //
translated: The realization of that is the attainment.

original: thams cad ni sems can gyi khams sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni sems can gyi khams sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: All is the various realms of sentient beings.

original: de'i dgos pa mdzad pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa mdzad pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don mdzad pa'o //
translated: The performance of their purpose is the performance of the desired aim.

original: dgos pa mdzad pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: dgos pa mdzad pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: Since he performs the purpose,🔽he is the one who performs the purpose.

original: dgos pa mdzad pa nyid de sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa thams @29a * //
analyzed: dgos pa mdzad pa nyid de sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa thams @29a * //
translated: The purpose is the very activity, which is the fulfillment of all the hopes of all the realms of sentient beings without exception.

original: cad kyi re ba thams cad de rnam par thams cad du phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa thob par sred pa de yongs su skong ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: cad kyi re ba thams cad de rnam par thams cad du phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa thob par sred pa de yongs su skong ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The fulfillment of all hopes is the desire to attain the Great Seal and so forth in all ways.

original: de nyid ni phrin las te de mdzad pas na re ba thams cad skong ba'i phrin las mdzad pa'o /
analyzed: de nyid ni phrin las te de mdzad pas na re ba thams cad skong ba'i phrin las mdzad pa'o /
translated: That very thing is the activity, and since he performs that, he is the one who performs the activity of fulfilling all hopes.

original: ma lus pa'i sgra zad bar gyi ming la yang 'jug srid de /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i sgra zad bar gyi ming la yang 'jug srid de /
translated: The word “without exception” can also be applied to the word “all,”

original: des na lus pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras zad par gyi don ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na lus pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras zad par gyi don ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: and thus the word “without exception” indicates the meaning of “all.”

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das las kyi rigs thugs su chud pa dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par ston pa /
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das las kyi rigs thugs su chud pa dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par ston pa /
translated: This also shows that the Bhagavān has realized the karma family and the perfection of the benefit of others.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pas kyang sems can rnams rjes su bzung zhing /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pas kyang sems can rnams rjes su bzung zhing /
translated: Those who wish to practice the conduct of the gateway of mantra should also take care of sentient beings.

original: rig pa grub pas dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa'i las rnams la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bar ston to //🔽de lta bu su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa grub pas dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa'i las rnams la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bar ston to // de lta bu su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: The one is the one who is endowed with great compassion, Vairocana, etc.

original: thugs rje che ba rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thugs rje che ba rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The one is the one who is endowed with great compassion, Vairocana, etc.

original: dmigs su med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang gi ngag gis 'jug pa 'di la mnga' bas na thugs rje che ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang gi ngag gis 'jug pa 'di la mnga' bas na thugs rje che ba'o //
translated: He is endowed with great compassion because he is the one who is endowed with the great compassion that is non-objectifiable and engages in the welfare of others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyi tshul gyis rnam par snang zhing 'bar bar gyur pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyi tshul gyis rnam par snang zhing 'bar bar gyur pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: He is Vairocana because he is the one who is radiant and blazing with the mode of the Tathagata's lineage, etc.

original: de nyid ni chos chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i skus rtag pa yin zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum po ni dus gsum ste dus gsum po de dag tu kun rdzob tu sprul pa'i skus bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni chos chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i skus rtag pa yin zhing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum po ni dus gsum ste dus gsum po de dag tu kun rdzob tu sprul pa'i skus bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He is eternal because he is eternal with the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, and the Transformation Body. He is in the three times because he is present in the three times, the past, future, and present, in the conventional Transformation Body.

original: yang na dus gsum po rnams su na kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis bzhugs la //
analyzed: yang na dus gsum po rnams su na kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis bzhugs la //
translated: Or else, they abide in the three times in the manner of the relative.

original: don dam par ni dus yod pa ma yin pas dus gsum du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni dus yod pa ma yin pas dus gsum du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: But ultimately, time does not exist, so they abide in the three times.

original: sku thams cad ni ngo bo nyid dang / rnam par smin pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sku thams cad ni ngo bo nyid dang / rnam par smin pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: All bodies are of four kinds, distinguished as the essential body, the body of maturation, the body of complete enjoyment, and the emanation body.

original: de la gang dag du ma rgya chen po //
analyzed: de la gang dag du ma rgya chen po //
translated: Among them, those that are manifold and vast

original: kha dog dang ni dbyibs dang gdan //
analyzed: kha dog dang ni dbyibs dang gdan //
translated: are distinguished by color, shape, seat,

original: phyag mtshan la sogs dbye ba 'di //
analyzed: phyag mtshan la sogs dbye ba 'di //
translated: hand implements, and so forth.

original: sku yi gsang bar rig par bya //
analyzed: sku yi gsang bar rig par bya //
translated: This should be known as the secret of the body.

original: gsung thams cad ni rdo rje dang / khro bo dang / chos dang / gsal ba'i dbye bas phye ba'o //
analyzed: gsung thams cad ni rdo rje dang / khro bo dang / chos dang / gsal ba'i dbye bas phye ba'o //
translated: All speech is distinguished by the divisions of the vajra, wrathful, dharma, and illuminating.

original: thugs thams cad ni thugs ka'i zla bar /
analyzed: thugs thams cad ni thugs ka'i zla bar /
translated: All minds are the mind of the moon at the heart,

original: dang po'i rdo rje dang / khro bo'i rdo rje dang / rdo rje padma dang / rdo rje rin chen dang / sna tshogs rdo rje ste /
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje dang / khro bo'i rdo rje dang / rdo rje padma dang / rdo rje rin chen dang / sna tshogs rdo rje ste /
translated: the first vajra, the wrathful vajra, the vajra lotus, the vajra jewel, and the variegated vajra.

original: 'di dag gang @29b la mnga' ba de ni sku dang gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gang @29b la mnga' ba de ni sku dang gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: He who possesses these is the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin pas sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i de bzhin gshegs pa ste /🔽dngos po thams cad ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin thugs su chud pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ston par mdzad pas kyang sangs rgyas ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin pas sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i de bzhin gshegs pa ste / dngos po thams cad ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin thugs su chud pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ston par mdzad pas kyang sangs rgyas ni /
translated: He is the Tathagata, and so he is the Tathagata of vajra body, speech, and mind.🔽The Buddha is called the Tathagata because he has realized things as they are

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because he teaches others in the same way.

original: 'dis kyang gang la thob pa'i ston pa po 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa rnam par snang mdzad yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'dis kyang gang la thob pa'i ston pa po 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa rnam par snang mdzad yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: This also explains that the teacher who has attained this is Vairocana, the condensation of all the Buddhas into one.

original: dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mdo las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mdo las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the sutra of the samadhi of the initial application teaches that he is the essence of the five Tathagatas.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bshad pa sngon du 'gro bas bstan par byas na /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bshad pa sngon du 'gro bas bstan par byas na /
translated: Thus, having explained the qualities of the Lord as a preamble, he now teaches🔽.

original: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das gang na bzhugs rtog pa la /
analyzed: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das gang na bzhugs rtog pa la /
translated: Having reflected on the Bhagavat who possesses such qualities, he says, Where does the Bhagavat dwell?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa ni bzhugs par mdzad pa'o //🔽de bas na bsngags pa yin la bsngags pa nyid kyis ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa ni bzhugs par mdzad pa'o // de bas na bsngags pa yin la bsngags pa nyid kyis ni bstod pa'o //
translated: He says, In the abode of all the Tathagatas, and so on.

original: der nor bu chen po ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnams so //
analyzed: der nor bu chen po ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnams so //
translated: The abode of all the Tathagatas is the place where they dwell, and that is adorned with great jewels, wish-fulfilling gems, and so on.

original: rin po che ni rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che ni rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ornaments are the diamonds and so on.

original: de rnams kyis spras pa ni gang du mdzes par bya ba'i phyir spel zhing bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis spras pa ni gang du mdzes par bya ba'i phyir spel zhing bkod pa'o //
translated: They are adorned in the sense that they are scattered and arranged in order to beautify the place.

original: der kha dog sna tshogs shing dril bu btags pa dang / dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / rnga ma dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pa dang / zla ba rlung gis bskyod pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas shing brgyan po'o //
analyzed: der kha dog sna tshogs shing dril bu btags pa dang / dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / rnga ma dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pa dang / zla ba rlung gis bskyod pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas shing brgyan po'o //
translated: There, variegated refers to the various colors of the bells, silk, banners, flower garlands, tassels, nets, half-nets, and moon-shaped decorations that are moved by the wind.🔽They are adorned in the sense that they are arranged in order to beautify the place.

original: 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs pa ni gnas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs pa ni gnas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the abode of the king of the gods of Akaniṣṭha is the abiding.🔽Since it is Akaniṣṭha and also the king of the gods, it is the Akaniṣṭha king of the gods.

original: 'og min kyang yin la lha'i rgyal po yang yin pas na 'og min lha'i rgyal po dang / bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang 'dzad dang po'i thu bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og min kyang yin la lha'i rgyal po yang yin pas na 'og min lha'i rgyal po dang / bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang 'dzad dang po'i thu bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is the abode of the Bhagavān Vairocana, it is the first of the foremost.

original: gnas de ni de nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas de ni de nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin te /
translated: That abode is his alone, not anyone else's.

original: de bas na rang gi gnas na bzhugs pa yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi gnas na bzhugs pa yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it shows that he abides in his own abode.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin /🔽mi mnyam pa med pas zur bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhal yas khang ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin / mi mnyam pa med pas zur bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhal yas khang ston pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, in the reality of the maṇḍala, the nature of the qualities of the Tathāgata
is shown by having four corners without any inequality, and so on, showing the immeasurable palace.🔽These

original: dag kyang 'di'i 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dag kyang 'di'i 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: will be explained below.

original: de yang gzhan dag la mi srid do //
analyzed: de yang gzhan dag la mi srid do //
translated: Moreover, that is not possible for others.

original: 'dis ni gang du thos pa des ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang du thos pa des ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows where it is heard.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi bzhugs gnas kyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi bzhugs gnas kyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of the abode of the Lord,

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the perfection of the retinue,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: he says, “the bodhisattva,” and so on.

original: 'di'i phyag na rdo rje mnga' bas na phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyag na rdo rje mnga' bas na phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: Since he has Vajra in his hand, he is Vajrapāṇi.

original: gzigs pas na kun du spyan ras gzigs te /
analyzed: gzigs pas na kun du spyan ras gzigs te /
translated: Since he sees, he is Avalokita.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag po'o zhes so sor rtogs par mdzad pa dang / sems can rnams bskyab pa'i phyir gzigs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag po'o zhes so sor rtogs par mdzad pa dang / sems can rnams bskyab pa'i phyir gzigs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who realizes that all phenomena are pure by nature, and he sees in order to protect sentient beings.

original: de'i dbang po ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang po ni gtso bo'o //
translated: His faculty is the chief one.

original: nam mkha'i ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye so /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye so /
translated: The sky is the abode of sameness.

original: snying po ni skye ba med pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: snying po ni skye ba med pa'i gnas te /
