analyzed: 'di dag mdzad par ji ltar spyod pa yin zhe na / di'i phyir / yang dag sangs rgyas kun bdag nyid /
translated: How do they perform it?🔽Therefore, he says,

original: @37a * // ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @37a * // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: the nature of all the perfect buddhas.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas na yang dag pa nyid do //🔽sems can rnams kyi don la chags pas na sems can te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas na yang dag pa nyid do // sems can rnams kyi don la chags pas na sems can te /
translated: It is the nature of reality, and so it is the perfect.

original: sems can gyi don la chags pa na sems can no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings ston par mdzad pas na /🔽rtag tu don rtogs mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la chags pa na sems can no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings ston par mdzad pas na / rtag tu don rtogs mdzad pa'o //
translated: It is a sentient being because it is attached to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sngon po ni lha chen po'i gzugs su sems can gyi don du byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po ni lha chen po'i gzugs su sems can gyi don du byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: It is a sentient being because it is attached to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sku chen po ni sdong po chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sku chen po ni sdong po chen po'o //
translated: It is the great tree because it is the trunk of the great body that is the antidote to that.

original: nag po chen po'i gzugs kyis sems can 'dul bar mdzad pas na nag po chen po'o /
analyzed: nag po chen po'i gzugs kyis sems can 'dul bar mdzad pas na nag po chen po'o /
translated: It is the great black one because it is the subduer of sentient beings in the form of the great black one.

original: dpal mchog dang po las bshad pa'i lha mo bzhi yang dag par 'dus pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i tshul dang ldan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'dod chags chen pa'o //
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po las bshad pa'i lha mo bzhi yang dag par 'dus pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i tshul dang ldan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'dod chags chen pa'o //
translated: It is the great passion because it is Vajrasattva endowed with the method of union such as the perfect union of the four goddesses explained in the Shriparamådya.

original: de nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas na bde ba che ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas na bde ba che ste /
translated: Since that is the nature of nondual intuition, it is great bliss.

original: mi 'gyur bde ba kun grub pa //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bde ba kun grub pa //
translated: It is explained in the scriptures as the accomplishment of unchanging bliss,

original: bde ba chen po zhes bshad do //🔽zhes lung las bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bshad do // zhes lung las bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and as great bliss.

original: phyag rgya bzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis dngos grub thams cad bsdus pa yin pas na thabs chen no //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis dngos grub thams cad bsdus pa yin pas na thabs chen no //
translated: Since it is the method of the mandala of the four seals, it is the great method.

original: rgyu 'di nyid kyis na mchog chen chog go //
analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyis na mchog chen chog go //
translated: For that very reason, it is the great supreme.

original: phyag rgya gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis na kun gyi chog go //
analyzed: phyag rgya gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis na kun gyi chog go //
translated: Since it is the nature of the mandala of the single seal, it is the all-purpose.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnas kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnas kyi dbang po'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is the lord of abodes.

original: de lta bu de su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu de su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Who is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Bhagavān, etc.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rgyas kyi byang chub la ltos na 'di ni byang chub kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na byang chub chen po ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rgyas kyi byang chub la ltos na 'di ni byang chub kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na byang chub chen po ste /
translated: Compared to the enlightenment of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, this is enlightenment and it is great, thus it is great enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the mind’s perfect knowledge of things as they are.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi thugs 'di la mnga' bas na bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i thugs zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi thugs 'di la mnga' bas na bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i thugs zhes bshad do //
translated: Since he has mastery over this kind of mind, he is called the Blessed One, the Great Bodhisattva.

original: kun du bzang po ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: kun du bzang po ni bshad zin to //
translated: Samantabhadra has already been explained.

original: de nyid ni byang chub chen po'i rang bzhin yin pas na byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni byang chub chen po'i rang bzhin yin pas na byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: Since he is the nature of great awakening, he is the Great Bodhisattva.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi @37b thugs kar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs la /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi @37b thugs kar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs la /
translated: In the hearts of all the Tathāgatas, such as Vairocana, in the form of a moon disc,

original: dang po'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs kyis gnas so zhes bya ba ni bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs kyis gnas so zhes bya ba ni bzhugs pa'o //
translated: the five-pronged vajra of the first [Tathāgata] abides. This is the dwelling.

original: dang po'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs kyis ni sku dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs kyis ni sku dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The five-pronged vajra of the first [Tathāgata] is not endowed with a body.

original: 'di gang las shes she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las shes she na /
translated: From where is this known?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: bcom ldan de nyid sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: bcom ldan de nyid sems dpa' yi //
translated: The Bhagavat is the essence of the Bodhisattva’s

original: rdo rje'i ngo bo'i thugs dag / de nyid rgyal bar gyur pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ngo bo'i thugs dag / de nyid rgyal bar gyur pa yin //
translated: mind, which is the vajra. He is the Victorious One.

original: rdo rje'i sems dpa' zhes bshad pa //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sems dpa' zhes bshad pa //
translated: He is explained as the vajra being.

original: rdo rje der ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje der ni rab tu gnas //
translated: The vajra is well-established in him.

original: de nyid ye shes sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of that very wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas zhes ni bshad pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes ni bshad pa ste //
translated: he is explained as the Buddha.

original: thugs las na tshogs byung nas ni //
analyzed: thugs las na tshogs byung nas ni //
translated: The assembly of the mind arises

original: sna rtogs gzugs su 'ang gyur pa yin //
analyzed: sna rtogs gzugs su 'ang gyur pa yin //
translated: and becomes the form of the world.

original: khams kun rdul gyi grangs snyed dag / de nyid rgyal bar gyur pa yin //🔽rdo rje'i sku ni de rnams las //
analyzed: khams kun rdul gyi grangs snyed dag / de nyid rgyal bar gyur pa yin // rdo rje'i sku ni de rnams las //
translated: The Victorious One is the same as the number of atoms in all the elements.🔽The vajra body arises

original: rdo rje sems dpa' 'ang 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' 'ang 'byung ba yin //
translated: from those vajra beings.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what the Bhagavat Vajradhara has said.

original: 'dis ni skyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog dang / las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi mdo 'dis rigs bzhi'i mdo bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni skyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog dang / las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi mdo 'dis rigs bzhi'i mdo bshad pa yin no //
translated: This sutra explains the two supreme samadhis of the mandala king and the supreme karma king.

original: gleng gzhi'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the nidana is complete.

original: // / de ltar rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po bstan pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i skyes bo'i mngon par 'dod pa skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: // / de ltar rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po bstan pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba'i skyes bo'i mngon par 'dod pa skyes pa yin la /
translated: Thus, Vairocana and Mahāvairocana have been taught, the Tathāgata who is characterized by the result of the perfection of one’s own and others’ aims, and the desire of the disciples has arisen.

original: mngon par 'dod pa skyes bar gyur ba rnams bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur zhes rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa skyes bar gyur ba rnams bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur zhes rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba la /
translated: Those whose desire has arisen think, “How can we attain that Blessed One who is characterized by the result of the perfection of one’s own and others’ aims?”

original: ngo bo nyid de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to actualize that nature,🔽then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: is stated.

original: de thob par byed pa'i thabs su rgyud gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i thabs su rgyud gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The tantra is taught as the means to attain that.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag pa ste /
translated: The word then refers to the immediately preceding.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rjes thogs pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rjes thogs pa'o //
translated: It is the immediate aftermath of the conceptions of the disciples.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: All the Tathagatas are Vairocana, Akshobhya, etc., equal to the atoms in all world-realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis so //🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di zhes bya ba @38a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis so // sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di zhes bya ba @38a * //
translated: All the Tathagatas means all the Buddhas.

original: ni mi mdzod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gling bzhi pa phrag brgyal sogs pa'i rnam grags yod pa'o //
analyzed: ni mi mdzod kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gling bzhi pa phrag brgyal sogs pa'i rnam grags yod pa'o //
translated: This Buddha-field means the Saha world-realm, with its billion four-island world-systems, etc.

original: dper na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The word “like” indicates the example.

original: til gyi gang bu bzhin du yongs su gang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: til gyi gang bu bzhin du yongs su gang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: It is completely filled, like a filled sesame pod, means that, as before, one should recollect the Buddha.

original: des mngon sum du byas nas zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des mngon sum du byas nas zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows that one should make it manifest.

original: sngags kyi sgo'i spyod pa rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo'i spyod pa rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should also cultivate the recollection of the Buddha through the practice of the Mantra Vehicle.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzugs kyi sku dang chos nyid rjes su dran par bya'o zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzugs kyi sku dang chos nyid rjes su dran par bya'o zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to realize I should recollect the form-bodies and reality of all Tathagatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad khyab nas ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad khyab nas ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: Having pervaded all Buddha-fields, what did he do?

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then and so on is stated.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word then. is as before.

original: 'dus te zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshul gyis rdzogs par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus te zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshul gyis rdzogs par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Having gathered means having completed by the method of inclusion.

original: de lta bu mdzad nas so //
analyzed: de lta bu mdzad nas so //
translated: Having done such,

original: byang chub la dgongs shing sems dpa'i thugs 'di la mnga' bas nas byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub la dgongs shing sems dpa'i thugs 'di la mnga' bas nas byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: he is a Bodhisattva because he has the mind of a Bodhisattva, intent on enlightenment.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don chen po mdzad pa la rab tu 'jug pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don chen po mdzad pa la rab tu 'jug pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: He is a great being because he engages in the great benefit of the great assembly of sentient beings.

original: don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas don thams cad grub par bya bzhed pa tsam la rag las pa 'di las pa 'di la mnga' bas na don thams cad grub pa'o //
analyzed: don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas don thams cad grub par bya bzhed pa tsam la rag las pa 'di las pa 'di la mnga' bas na don thams cad grub pa'o //
translated: The one called “accomplisher of all aims” is the one who has power over the mere wish to accomplish all aims, since he has completed the accumulations of merit and direct intuition, and is the essence of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu'i snying po ni byang chub kyi snying po ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu'i snying po ni byang chub kyi snying po ste /
translated: The essence of enlightenment is the essence of the cause of enlightenment.

original: mar gyi snying po dang 'dra bar gnas kyi snying por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mar gyi snying po dang 'dra bar gnas kyi snying por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is like the essence of butter, since it is the essence of the abode.

original: der bzhugs pa ni nye bar gnas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: der bzhugs pa ni nye bar gnas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The one who abides there is the one who is present there.

original: gang na bar zhes bya bar zhes bya ba'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gang na bar zhes bya bar zhes bya ba'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: The third reason is “because he is present there”.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te gang gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du skye ba sna tshogs pa ba zhes te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te gang gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du skye ba sna tshogs pa ba zhes te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The one who, for three incalculable aeons, has gone through various births,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad nas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad nas /
translated: and has completed the accumulations of merit and direct intuition,

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed de /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed de /
translated: and has generated the meditative concentration and the formless attainments,

original: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i chen po'i yang chen po bskyed nas ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus can gyi srid pa tha ma par mdzad nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i chen po'i yang chen po bskyed nas ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus can gyi srid pa tha ma par mdzad nas /
translated: Having generated the great-great stage of the fourth concentration, by the power of concentration he became a being of the final existence with a mental body.🔽Having received the empowerment of the crown and the hanging ribbons from all the tathagatas, he thought, “I will attain buddhahood in order to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad las cod pan dang / dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur ba thob @38b nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes dgongs nas dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba bkag ste bcom ldan das don thams cad grub pa 'og min gyi gnas byang chub kyi snying po na bzhugs pa gang na ba der gshegs shing bzhud nas 'di skad cas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad las cod pan dang / dar dpyangs kyi dbang bskur ba thob @38b nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes dgongs nas dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba bkag ste bcom ldan das don thams cad grub pa 'og min gyi gnas byang chub kyi snying po na bzhugs pa gang na ba der gshegs shing bzhud nas 'di skad cas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Having stopped the inhalation and exhalation of breath, he went to the place where the bhagavat Sarvarthasiddha was residing in the Akanishtha realm in the heart of enlightenment and said this.

original: bcom ldan 'das bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sh'akya'i rigs su skye ba ston par mdzad do zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sh'akya'i rigs su skye ba ston par mdzad do zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: The Bhagavat, having manifestly and completely awakened after an inconceivable eon, demonstrated birth in the Shakya lineage.

original: sh'akya'i rigs su skye ba bzhes bya ba 'di la mi rigs so /
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs su skye ba bzhes bya ba 'di la mi rigs so /
translated: It is not reasonable that he would take birth in the Śākya clan.

original: gshegs nas kyang de rnams kyis de la ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gshegs nas kyang de rnams kyis de la ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: And after going there, what did he do for them?

original: ched du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ched du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He said, “For their sake…” and so on.

original: de la rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba sa chen po la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa rnams kyi chos kyi rdzogs longs spyod pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral ba sa chen po la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa rnams kyi chos kyi rdzogs longs spyod pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Therein, the enjoyment body is the enjoyment of the Dharma of the bodhisattvas who abide on the great stages, such as Samantabhadra, who are free from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa gang yin pa 'di ni chos kyi rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku dgongs pa yin pas rdzogs longs spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa gang yin pa 'di ni chos kyi rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku dgongs pa yin pas rdzogs longs spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the enjoyment body of Dharma, which is the intention of the enjoyment body. Therefore, it is called the enjoyment body.

original: de rnams kyis rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku bstan nas ji skad du gsungs she na /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku bstan nas ji skad du gsungs she na /
translated: Having taught the enjoyment body, how did they speak?

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: They said, “Son of noble family, yours…” and so on.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: Son of noble family is the salutation.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni spong ba'o //
translated: As to how, it is the rejection.

original: de'i gong na khyad par du gyur ba gzhan med pas na bla na med pa ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'o //🔽gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i gong na khyad par du gyur ba gzhan med pas na bla na med pa ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'o // gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Since there is nothing higher than it, it is unsurpassed, that is, the fivefold manifest enlightenment in perfect complete enlightenment.

original: ji srid de kho na nyid bsgom pa med par mi gyo ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'dis ni khyod mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ji srid de kho na nyid bsgom pa med par mi gyo ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'dis ni khyod mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: As to why, etc., it is thought that you will not become fully enlightened without this unwavering meditative stabilization which is the cultivation of reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ma rtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ma rtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, without realizing the reality of all the Tathāgatas, etc.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa de ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur na yang khyod ni mi gyo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bas bdag nyid gzir cing dka' ba spyod pa la zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa de ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur na yang khyod ni mi gyo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bas bdag nyid gzir cing dka' ba spyod pa la zhugs pa yin la /
translated: If one realizes the thatness of all tathāgatas, one will fully awaken, but you are engaged in tormenting yourself and practicing austerities by applying yourself to the meditative stabilization of immovability.

original: de bas na @39a * //
analyzed: de bas na @39a * //
translated: Therefore,🔽you will not fully awaken to thatness through austerities.

original: de kho na nyid me dpas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ro zhes /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bskul bas zhes bya bas /
analyzed: de kho na nyid me dpas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ro zhes / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bskul bas zhes bya bas /
translated: Thus,

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i tshig gis bskul bar gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i tshig gis bskul bar gyur ba yin no //
translated: since you were exhorted by all the tathāgatas with the words just mentioned,🔽you arose from the meditative stabilization of immovability.

original: de nas mi gyo ba'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs te zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de las ldang bar mdzad pa ste 'dis ni dbugs bkag pas gnas pa yin no zhes don shugs las shes te /
analyzed: de nas mi gyo ba'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs te zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de las ldang bar mdzad pa ste 'dis ni dbugs bkag pas gnas pa yin no zhes don shugs las shes te /
translated: This means that you emerged from that meditative stabilization. This indicates that you were abiding by stopping the breath.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la dregs pa 'chang bar gyur nas ni /🔽dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba bkag//
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la dregs pa 'chang bar gyur nas ni / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba bkag//
translated: Moreover, the Lord, having become arrogant about such a concentration,

original: ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas /
translated: he stopped the in-breath and out-breath,

original: aom badzro titshhsha zhes bskul bar byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: aom badzro titshhsha zhes bskul bar byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and so on up to he was urged with the words Oṃ vajrottiṣṭha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having made obeisance to all the Tathāgatas,

original: aom sa rbab ta th'a ga ta b'a da ba ndha ni ka ro mi zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: aom sa rbab ta th'a ga ta b'a da ba ndha ni ka ro mi zhes bya bas so //
translated: with the words Oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjāvratanidhukarohi,🔽 he said this,

original: 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni ji skad du zhus nas ci zhig smras pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni ji skad du zhus nas ci zhig smras pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show the nature of what he had asked and what he had said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: he said O Lord, the Tathāgatas, and so on.

original: de kho na nyid ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mngon par ma rtogs par zhes khyed rnams kyis gsungs pa'i'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mngon par ma rtogs par zhes khyed rnams kyis gsungs pa'i'o //
translated: What is reality? means by what is the reality of all the Tathagatas not realized? as you have said.

original: ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu'i de kho na nyid bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu'i de kho na nyid bsgoms pas so //
translated: How should it be accomplished? means by what kind of reality should it be cultivated?

original: gsung gcig tu 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa gcig gis de kho na nyid ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gsung gcig tu 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa gcig gis de kho na nyid ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: They spoke with one voice, saying Thus means that with one intention they taught reality.

original: sgrub par gyis shig ces bya ba ni nyams su blang bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par gyis shig ces bya ba ni nyams su blang bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Accomplish it means practice it.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said by examining one's own mind and so on.

original: rang nyid kyi sems ni rang gi sems te de la so sor rtog pa ni rgyud dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'o zhes so sor rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sems ni rang gi sems te de la so sor rtog pa ni rgyud dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'o zhes so sor rtag pa'o //
translated: One's own mind is one's own mind. Examining it means all phenomena are pure by nature because of being free from a continuum.

original: de'i don du mnyam par 'jog pa ni rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par zhog la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i don du mnyam par 'jog pa ni rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par zhog la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For that purpose, settle evenly means settle evenly, discerning your own mind.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid du'o //
translated: That is, in a one-pointed mind.

original: mnyam par gzhag pas sgrub par gyis shig ces bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi @39b gzhan yang rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas sgrub par gyis shig ces bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi @39b gzhan yang rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste /
translated: Not only settle evenly, but also by nature means by nature, that is, by intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sngags ci dgar zlos shig ces bya ba'i grangs kyi nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sngags ci dgar zlos shig ces bya ba'i grangs kyi nges pa med pa ste /
translated: Recite the mantra of intrinsic nature as you like means without a fixed number of recitations.

original: gang gi phyir 'tshang rgya ba thob par bya ba la ni bsgom par bya ba nyid gtso bor gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'tshang rgya ba thob par bya ba la ni bsgom par bya ba nyid gtso bor gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in attaining Buddhahood, meditation is primary.

original: ci dgar ba zlas pa'i sngas 'di yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci dgar ba zlas pa'i sngas 'di yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this mantra of intrinsic nature that is recited as one likes?

original: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka ro mi zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is taught as Om, I will generate the mind of awakening.

original: sems zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin so sor gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po med pa nyid du nges par bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin so sor gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po med pa nyid du nges par bya ba ni /
translated: The mind is the nature of the mental consciousness, etc. It is to be ascertained as devoid of the duality of the grasped and the grasper.

original: tsi tta pra ti be dham zes pa so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tsi tta pra ti be dham zes pa so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The discernment of the mind is the discernment of each of those.

original: yang na bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs pas shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs pas shes pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the knowledge that is the complete abandonment of the afflictions together with their traces.

original: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i bzlas pa dang bsgoms pas chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa mngon sum du byas pas na /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i bzlas pa dang bsgoms pas chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa mngon sum du byas pas na /
translated: Thus, by the recitation and meditation as explained above, one realizes the beginningless and endless dharmadhatu.

original: bdag gi snying gar zla ba'i skyil 'khor lta bur bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya bar rang gi snying ga na nges pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bdag gi snying gar zla ba'i skyil 'khor lta bur bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya bar rang gi snying ga na nges pa'i ye shes so //
translated: One sees it as a moon mandala in one's heart.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo zla ba'i dbyings kyi yi ge bcu drug las byung ba nang la sogs pa stong ba nyid bcu drug ston par byed pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las skyes pa'i ye shes kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par🔽mthong ngo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo zla ba'i dbyings kyi yi ge bcu drug las byung ba nang la sogs pa stong ba nyid bcu drug ston par byed pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las skyes pa'i ye shes kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par mthong ngo zhes pa ste /
translated: One sees the form of the moon mandala of transcendent wisdom arisen from the aftermath of transcendent wisdom.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid mig yor tsam du so sor snang bas nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu sgom par bshad pa'i rgyud las bstan pas nas som nyi mi bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid mig yor tsam du so sor snang bas nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu sgom par bshad pa'i rgyud las bstan pas nas som nyi mi bya'o //
translated: Since the moon mandala itself appears individually like a mirage, one should not doubt the explanation in the tantra that it is meditated upon like a moon mandala.

original: kha cig ni tshes gcig pa'i zla ba'i ri mo 'dra ba'i zla ba 'di dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni tshes gcig pa'i zla ba'i ri mo 'dra ba'i zla ba 'di dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that this moon like the pattern of a first day moon is like a mandala.

original: gzhan dag na re de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Others say that is not correct.🔽That is because it is said:

original: de yang / gang 'di zla ba rdzogs pa 'di //
analyzed: de yang / gang 'di zla ba rdzogs pa 'di //
translated: This is the full moon

original: dag cing gsal la rnyog pa med /
analyzed: dag cing gsal la rnyog pa med /
translated: Pure, clear and unpolluted.

original: de bzhin tshogs ni rdzogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin tshogs ni rdzogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Likewise, the assembly is complete

original: sems ni zla brgyas pa 'dra //
analyzed: sems ni zla brgyas pa 'dra //
translated: The mind is like a full moon.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dis ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo mi bskyed pa'i rang bzhin du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo mi bskyed pa'i rang bzhin du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By this, the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment is said to be non-generated.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: By naturally is meant by its very nature.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ni dra ma med pa'i don te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po'i bag chags kyi nag nog dang @40a * //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ni dra ma med pa'i don te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po'i bag chags kyi nag nog dang @40a * //
translated: By clear light is meant without darkness, free from the darkness of the instincts of subject and object,

original: bral ba la glo bur ba'i dri mas dri mas can du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba la glo bur ba'i dri mas dri mas can du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not made dirty by the adventitious defilements, being not dirty by nature.

original: 'di ni ji ltar sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni ji ltar sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said by purified as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i skur bsgoms pas gang dang gang dag gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i skur bsgoms pas gang dang gang dag gis so //
translated: By meditating on the body of the Tathagata, etc., is meant by whatever.

original: de ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de dang des shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de dang des shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By it becomes like that is meant it becomes very clear by that and by that.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said for example, etc.

original: ji ltar ras dkar po dri ma thams cad dang bral ba tshon gyis kha bsgyur ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar ras dkar po dri ma thams cad dang bral ba tshon gyis kha bsgyur ba ni /
translated: Just as a white cloth, free from all stains, is dyed by the dye,

original: padma r'a ga la sogs pa'i mdog tu mdog shin tu gsal bar de'i mdog can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: padma r'a ga la sogs pa'i mdog tu mdog shin tu gsal bar de'i mdog can du 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes the color of ruby, etc., very clear in color, the color of that.

original: de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: he is like that.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Therefore” and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bral ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / bral ba'o //
translated: Natural luminosity is the nature itself, free from the concepts of subject and object.

original: de gang zhig ce na sems so //
analyzed: de gang zhig ce na sems so //
translated: What is that? The mind.

original: de'i shes ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Its knowledge is realization.

original: de rgyas par bya ba ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bskyed par bya ba ni rgyas par bya ba ste /🔽rgyu de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la 'jug par bya'o /
analyzed: de rgyas par bya ba ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bskyed par bya ba ni rgyas par bya ba ste / rgyu de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la 'jug par bya'o /
translated: Its expansion is the creation of a second moon disk on the moon disk that has the nature of the perfection of means.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: For that reason, one should enter into the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ston par byed pa'i yi ge ka la sogs pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ston par byed pa'i yi ge ka la sogs pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bskyed pa ni /
translated: The generation of the second moon disk from the letters such as ka that reveal the nature of Vairochana, etc.

original: byang chub sems bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems bskyed pa yin te /
translated: is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: yi ge ka la sogs pa skar ma lta bu'i gzugs can las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bskyed par bsam mo zhes bshad pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ka la sogs pa skar ma lta bu'i gzugs can las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa bskyed par bsam mo zhes bshad pa'i rgyud las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said in the Tantra that one should imagine the generation of the second moon disk from the letters such as ka, which have the form of stars.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur mthong ba gang lags pa de ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid du mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur mthong ba gang lags pa de ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid du mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is seen as a moon disk is seen as a moon disk

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: means the following:

original: sems so sor rtog pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur so sor snang ba gang yin pa de la byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa bsgoms pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i gzugs can gnyis pa nyid du mthong ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems so sor rtog pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur so sor snang ba gang yin pa de la byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa bsgoms pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i gzugs can gnyis pa nyid du mthong ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: The generation of the second moon disk, which has the form of a great moon disk, is seen by the cultivation of the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the individually discriminating pristine wisdom that individually appears as a moon disk.

original: de yang zla ba'i dbus su 'ang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa mthong ba yin zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang zla ba'i dbus su 'ang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa mthong ba yin zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And in the middle of the moon, he sees a second moon disk.

original: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin @40b pa'i bdag nyid can rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin @40b pa'i bdag nyid can rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is said to be the essence of Ratnasaṃbhava, whose nature is the perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po ni der nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po ni der nges pa'o //
translated: The essence of all the tathāgatas is ascertained there.

original: kun du bzang po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral zhing sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral zhing sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: Samantabhadra is free from attachment and so forth, and is the cause for fulfilling all the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: de gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the generation of the mind.

original: ji ltar zhe na khyod kyis mngon sum du gyur gyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na khyod kyis mngon sum du gyur gyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: How is it? It is said, “You have become manifest.”

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs dang mnyam pa nyid thob pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs dang mnyam pa nyid thob pa des na /
translated: Because he has attained the sameness of mind with all the tathāgatas,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po'i gzugs su gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po'i gzugs su gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the essence of all the Tathagatas, which has become a form.

original: brtan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa so sor brtags pas dngos por gzung bar bya ba nye bar mi dmigs pa ni brtan par bya ste de'i phyi ro //
analyzed: brtan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa so sor brtags pas dngos por gzung bar bya ba nye bar mi dmigs pa ni brtan par bya ste de'i phyi ro //
translated: For the sake of stability means that the non-apprehension of the object to be taken hold of by the investigation of the intrinsically pure is to be stabilized, and that is the second stage.

original: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: On the moon-disk at one's heart means

original: dang po'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / gzhi'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i dbyi bas su soms shig ces pa ni sgoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / gzhi'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i dbyi bas su soms shig ces pa ni sgoms shig pa'o //
translated: Think of it as a five-pronged vajra on the first moon-disk and the basic moon-disk! is imagine it!

original: bsgoms pa 'ba' zhig tu zad dam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa 'ba' zhig tu zad dam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it just meditation? No, it is not.

original: sngags 'dis zhes bya ba gsungs so//
analyzed: sngags 'dis zhes bya ba gsungs so//
translated: The mantra is is stated.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis par rdo rje ra ba bsgoms pas kyang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis par rdo rje ra ba bsgoms pas kyang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: By meditating on the vajra fence on the second moon-disk, one should also apprehend it as having the nature of Vairochana, etc.

original: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer bshad //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer bshad //
translated: Emptiness is explained as the vajra.

original: ces 'byung bas na rdo rje'i phyag rgya ni stong pa nyid kyi rdo rje ni rang bzhin du ston bar byed pa yin no /
analyzed: ces 'byung bas na rdo rje'i phyag rgya ni stong pa nyid kyi rdo rje ni rang bzhin du ston bar byed pa yin no /
translated: Thus, the vajra seal is the vajra of emptiness, which is taught to be the nature.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the nature of the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of Amitābha.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis par rdo rje rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di gang las shes she na /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis par rdo rje rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di gang las shes she na /
translated: How do we know that we should meditate on a vajra on the second moon maṇḍala?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because it is said:

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i dbus su ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i dbus su ni //
translated: In the center of the second maṇḍala,

original: rdo rje chen po rnam bsams la //
analyzed: rdo rje chen po rnam bsams la //
translated: imagine a great vajra.

original: yid tsam so sor brtags pa ni //🔽theg pa chen po brtan pa yin //
analyzed: yid tsam so sor brtags pa ni // theg pa chen po brtan pa yin //
translated: Just a little bit of analysis

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: is the stability of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di brtan par bya ste /🔽rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar bsgoms pas stong pa nyid rdo rje'i bdag nyid can du sbyor bas 'dzin po mi dmigs pa ni @41a * //
analyzed: 'di brtan par bya ste / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar bsgoms pas stong pa nyid rdo rje'i bdag nyid can du sbyor bas 'dzin po mi dmigs pa ni @41a * //
translated: This should be stabilized.

original: brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: brtan par bya'o //
translated: By meditating on natural luminosity, one should stabilize the non-observation of the apprehender through the yoga that has the nature of the vajra of emptiness.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is taught:

original: aom badzra aatma ko& ham zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: aom badzra aatma ko& ham zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-ātmako 'haṃ.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the realm of space, and so on.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du yang dag par mnyam par 'jug cing khyab pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du mnyam par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du yang dag par mnyam par 'jug cing khyab pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du mnyam par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The realm of space is the entire space, which is pervaded and filled.

original: de gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The realm of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rdul phra rab rnams rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas na dbyings rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rdul phra rab rnams rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku la sogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas na dbyings rnams te /
translated: The atoms of the nature of Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi are the causes of the body, etc. of Vairocana, and thus are the realms.

original: 'dir khams kyi don ni rgyu'i don yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir khams kyi don ni rgyu'i don yin par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the meaning of dhātu is accepted as the meaning of cause.

original: de la sku'i gsang ba ni sku'i dbyings so //
analyzed: de la sku'i gsang ba ni sku'i dbyings so //
translated: The secret of body is the realm of the body.

original: gsung gi gsang ba ni gsung gi dbyings so //
analyzed: gsung gi gsang ba ni gsung gi dbyings so //
translated: The secret of speech is the realm of speech.

original: de rnams kyi thugs kar gnas pa'i sems dpa' rdo rje gang yin pa de ni thugs rdo rje'i dbyings so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thugs kar gnas pa'i sems dpa' rdo rje gang yin pa de ni thugs rdo rje'i dbyings so //
translated: The mind-vajra that resides in their hearts is the realm of the mind-vajra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: All the Tathagatas are the Lord Vairocana, Akshobhya, and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba yang /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba yang /
translated: Their minds and mental factors

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: are also all the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs ni khab long gis lcags 'dren pa dang 'dra bar nus pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs ni khab long gis lcags 'dren pa dang 'dra bar nus pa skyed pa'o //
translated: Their consecration is the generation of the power, like a magnet attracting iron.

original: sems dpa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: The bodhisattva-vajra is the vajra located on the moon-disc.

original: der zhugs so zhes bya ba ni bye ma la bum pa'i chu blugs pa ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings ji skad bshad pa nyid rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku mngon par grub pa'i rgyu yin pas na rdo
analyzed: der zhugs so zhes bya ba ni bye ma la bum pa'i chu blugs pa ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings ji skad bshad pa nyid rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku mngon par grub pa'i rgyu yin pas na rdo
translated: The phrase one enters into that means that just as water is poured into a vase filled with sand, the realm of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all the tathagatas, as it has been explained, is the cause for the actualization of the body of Vairochana. Therefore, it is said that one enters into that.🔽🔽

original: rje dbyings te /
analyzed: rje dbyings te /
translated: The phrase he entered means that just as water is poured into a vase filled with sand, the realm of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all the tathagatas, as explained above, is the cause for the accomplishment of the body of Vairochana. Therefore, it is the vajra realm.

original: 'dis kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: 'dis kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid yin pas na /
translated: This also shows that since it is clear light by nature, the door of liberation,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis don yod par grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ston to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis don yod par grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ston to //
translated: it is Amoghasiddhi's nature, the perfection of effort.

original: kha cig ni gnas sa bas 'dir rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po yin no zhes zer mod kyi gzhan dag na re de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gnas sa bas 'dir rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po yin no zhes zer mod kyi gzhan dag na re de ni ma yin te /
translated: Some say that here it is the great seal of Vajrasattva, but others say that is not so,

original: khyad par gyi @41b tshig med pa'i phyir dang / 'og nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po de lta bas na /
analyzed: khyad par gyi @41b tshig med pa'i phyir dang / 'og nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po de lta bas na /
translated: because there is no special phrase and because it says below,🔽The great bodhisattva should think, I will attain the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathagatas.

original: sems dpa'i rdo rje de rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi skur bdag nyid sgoms shig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽sems dpa'i rdo rje'i sgras ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po yin par bshad do zhes bshad par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems dpa'i rdo rje de rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi skur bdag nyid sgoms shig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro // sems dpa'i rdo rje'i sgras ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po yin par bshad do zhes bshad par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Meditate on yourself as the body of a Buddha endowed with all supreme aspects, with the thought I am the vajra being.🔽It is not possible to explain the words vajra being as referring to the great seal of Vajrasattva,

original: yongs su 'a chad par bshad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'a chad par bshad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no explanation of the word vajra as a seal.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: The concentration of Vajrasattva

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid dgongs //🔽zhes bya ba gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid dgongs // zhes bya ba gtan tshigs yin no zhe na /
translated: is the intention of the reality of the Buddhas.🔽If you say that this is the reason,

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: it is not so, because

original: bcom ldan sems dpa' de nyid ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan sems dpa' de nyid ni //
translated: the Bhagavat himself is the being,🔽and

original: snying gar rdo rje bsgoms pa yis //
analyzed: snying gar rdo rje bsgoms pa yis //
translated: by meditating on the vajra at the heart,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bshad la //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bshad la //
translated: he is explained as Vajrasattva,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' der zhugs so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' der zhugs so //
translated: and Vajrasattva enters there.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nges pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdul phra rab 'dus pa las rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nges pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdul phra rab 'dus pa las rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs ni /
translated: Through the ascertainment of such statements, the form of the five-tined vajra is the composite of the subtle particles of all tathāgatas.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ste /
translated: By the certainty of such statements, the form of the five-pronged vajra, which is the aggregation of the atoms of all the Tathagatas, is the body of all the Tathagatas.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: It is the nature of that vajra, and so it is called the vajra of the body of all the Tathagatas.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rdo rje'i gzugs de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdul phra rab las bsgrubs pa'i bdag nyid du mthong gi mtshan dang dpe byad yongs su rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig pur ni ma yin
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rdo rje'i gzugs de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdul phra rab las bsgrubs pa'i bdag nyid du mthong gi mtshan dang dpe byad yongs su rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig pur ni ma yin
translated: Therefore, means that because that vajra form is seen as the nature of the aggregation of the atoms of all the Tathagatas, it is not just the body of a single Buddha, complete with the major and minor marks.

original: te / de bas na sems dpa'i rdo rje de ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku'i gsang ba'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: te / de bas na sems dpa'i rdo rje de ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku'i gsang ba'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: Therefore, that vajra of the beings is the body of the Buddhas, endowed with the highest of all aspects, and it is the nature of the secret body of the Tathagatas.

original: de bas na 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus par gyur pa rnam par gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus par gyur pa rnam par gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the transformation into Vairocana, the transformation of all the buddhas gathered into one.

original: mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i rim pa 'di la 'ang /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i rim pa 'di la 'ang /
translated: In this sequence of the five manifest enlightenments,

original: mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la sems so sor rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la sems so sor rtogs par bya'o //
translated: one should visualize Akṣobhya and bind the great seal of Akṣobhya.🔽Likewise, when generating the mind of enlightenment,

original: de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang ; rdo rje dang rdo rje'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsgom pa'i dus su /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang ; rdo rje dang rdo rje'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsgom pa'i dus su /
translated: when visualizing the vajra and the vajra-nature, and when visualizing all the tathāgatas,

original: mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o zhes bshad @42a * //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o zhes bshad @42a * //
translated: one should bind the great seals of Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, and Vairocana.

original: pa'i rgyud las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rgyud las bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught in the tantra.

original: byin gyis brlabs la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for blessing,

original: sems can gyi don du bya bar nus ba brtan phar mdzod cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du bya bar nus ba brtan phar mdzod cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: Make it firm for the sake of sentient beings.

original: brtan par mdzod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtan par mdzod ces bya ba ni /
translated: Make it firm means

original: mi phyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi phyed par bya ba ste /
translated: make it indivisible.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mas byin gyis brlabs pa dang / yi ge brgya pas brtan par bya ba ni 'o nas 'chad do //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mas byin gyis brlabs pa dang / yi ge brgya pas brtan par bya ba ni 'o nas 'chad do //
translated: The consecration by Vajradhātvīśvarī and the making firm by the hundred syllables will be explained later.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rdo rje dbyings kyi sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs so zhes bya ba ni /🔽ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham zhes bya ba'i bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rdo rje dbyings kyi sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs so zhes bya ba ni / ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham zhes bya ba'i bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: All the Tathāgatas enter into that vajra of the vajra being of the Vajra Realm means🔽the Bhagavān enters into that vajra of the being in his own heart that arises from the power of meditation on the mantra yatha tathāgatastathāham.

original: gang gi phyir sku gsung thugs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus de'i tshe nyid de bzhin gshegs par gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sku gsung thugs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus de'i tshe nyid de bzhin gshegs par gyur ba yin no //
translated: The meaning is: Because at the time of the consecration of body, speech, and mind with the vajra, one becomes a Tathāgata.

original: de nas zhugs pa dang rgyud phyi ma las gsungs pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mas /
analyzed: de nas zhugs pa dang rgyud phyi ma las gsungs pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mas /
translated: Then, having entered, one should generate the vajra realm

original: snying ga dang / dpral ba dang / lkog ma dang / spyi bor /
analyzed: snying ga dang / dpral ba dang / lkog ma dang / spyi bor /
translated: lord at the heart, forehead, throat, and crown,

original: rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rjes de la bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rjes de la bskyed par bya'o //
translated: with a vajra, jewel, lotus, and crossed vajra, respectively,🔽in accordance with the Later Tantra.

original: de nas yi ge brgya phas brtan par bya ba 'dis ni rang gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga yin la /
analyzed: de nas yi ge brgya phas brtan par bya ba 'dis ni rang gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga yin la /
translated: Then, one should stabilize with the hundred-syllable mantra. This is the rite taught in the Tantra of the Vajra Element.

original: aom sbra ta th'a ga ta aa bhi sam bo dhi dri dha badzra ti shatha zhes bya ba bshad pa'i rgyud las gsungs pas kyang byin gyis brlabs pa brtan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sbra ta th'a ga ta aa bhi sam bo dhi dri dha badzra ti shatha zhes bya ba bshad pa'i rgyud las gsungs pas kyang byin gyis brlabs pa brtan par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the consecration is stabilized by the statement in the explanatory tantra, Om, I stabilize the vajra of the essence of the Tathagata's consecration.

original: sems so sor rtog pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mngon par byang chub pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa dang / brtan par bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems so sor rtog pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mngon par byang chub pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa dang / brtan par bya ba ni /
translated: The complete enlightenment, consecration, and stabilization through the stages of the individual investigation of the mind and so forth are the three vajra points of the explanatory tantra.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma 'ongs pa'i gsang sngags kyi sgo la spyod pa spyad pa rnams kyi sgom pa'i lung 'bogs pa sbyin pa'i phyir ston par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma 'ongs pa'i gsang sngags kyi sgo la spyod pa spyad pa rnams kyi sgom pa'i lung 'bogs pa sbyin pa'i phyir ston par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The Lord teaches in order to give the instruction in meditation to those who will practice the mantra approach in the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyis rim pa 'dis sgom pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyis rim pa 'dis sgom pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: He teaches that those in the future should enter into meditation by this process.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das skad cig ma gcig nyid la ldog pa'i dbye bas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i skus tha dad par snang bas sam chos thams cad bdag med pa'i ye shes so sor mngon du mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das skad cig ma gcig nyid la ldog pa'i dbye bas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i skus tha dad par snang bas sam chos thams cad bdag med pa'i ye shes so sor mngon du mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the Lord, in a single moment, appears as Akshobhya, etc., by the division of the reversals, or he manifests the gnosis of the selflessness of all things.

original: de yang gang gi phyir skad cig ma de nyid kyi @42b * //🔽cho na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir skad cig ma de nyid kyi @42b * // cho na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: And that is because in that very moment🔽he is said to be the essence of all the Tathagatas.

original: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka rom mi zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe na'o //
analyzed: aom tsitta pra ti be dham ka rom mi zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe na'o //
translated: Om, Citta-prativedham-karo mi is said at that very moment.

original: 'di gang las shes she na gang gi phyir yang rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba na ni byang chub las nyams par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di gang las shes she na gang gi phyir yang rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba na ni byang chub las nyams par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is asked from what is this known, it is because when discursive thought arises, one falls from enlightenment.

original: de ltar ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is not accepted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rang bzhin can rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rang bzhin can rnams te /
translated: All tathāgatas are of the nature of the tathāgata family, such as Vajrasattva, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni don dam par de bzhin nyid du tshul gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ni don dam par de bzhin nyid du tshul gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Their sameness is the same mode in ultimate reality as suchness.

original: 'di nyid kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i tshul yang dbye ba med pas phye ba nyid ni kun rdzob kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i tshul yang dbye ba med pas phye ba nyid ni kun rdzob kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: This very mandala and so on are also the conventional sameness, because they are undifferentiated.

original: 'di'i nges pa ni ye shes te /
analyzed: 'di'i nges pa ni ye shes te /
translated: Its ascertainment is pristine consciousness.

original: de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: That is fully awakened buddhahood, which is realized.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje mnyam pa nyid ni rin po che'i rigs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi nyam pa nyid kyang snga ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje mnyam pa nyid ni rin po che'i rigs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi nyam pa nyid kyang snga ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The vajra sameness of all tathāgatas is the sameness of the nature of the ratna family, as before.

original: de'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the pristine consciousness.

original: de nyid ni phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni phyag rgya'o //
translated: That itself is the seal.

original: gsang ba yang de nyid do //
analyzed: gsang ba yang de nyid do //
translated: That itself is the secret.

original: de'i dam tshig ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i sbyin pas sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i sbyin pas sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Its commitment is to delight all sentient beings by the gift of consecration and so forth.

original: der zhugs pa ni thugs su chud pas de'i ngo bo nyid du skyed par rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: der zhugs pa ni thugs su chud pas de'i ngo bo nyid du skyed par rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Engaging in that, he has realized it, and so has generated it in the nature of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos ni padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos ni padma'i rigs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma of all the Tathagatas is the nature of the Lotus Family.

original: de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Their sameness is just that.

original: de'i ye shes ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni nges pa'o //
translated: Its intuition is the certainty.

original: de'i rtogs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rtogs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa'o //
translated: Its realization is the direct realization.

original: rdzogs pas der rang bzhin gyis dag pa ni padma'i rigs kyi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pas der rang bzhin gyis dag pa ni padma'i rigs kyi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
translated: The natural purity in that is the nature of the Lotus Family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni las kyi rigs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni las kyi rigs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the nature of the Action Family.

original: de rnams kyi thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni /
translated: Their sameness is

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the perfection of effort, which is the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: des rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes ni rang gi rgyud dang gdul bya'i rgyud la gong nas gong du khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes ni rang gi rgyud dang gdul bya'i rgyud la gong nas gong du khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: The naturally luminous intuition is the special development in the continuum of the Buddha himself and in the continua of those to be trained.

original: de'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa ni rigs su gyur pa'i las kyi rigs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa ni rigs su gyur pa'i las kyi rigs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The source of that is the essence of the family of the family of the action of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “he became a Tathagata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One” means

original: ye shes bzhi thugs su chud pa'i rjes thogs nyid kyi skad cig @43a * //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi thugs su chud pa'i rjes thogs nyid kyi skad cig @43a * //
translated: that in the very instant following the realization of the four intuitions,

original: ma gcig la /
analyzed: ma gcig la /
translated: in one instant,

original: aom ya th'a sarbba ta th'a ga t'a tasta th'a aa ham zhes bya ba'i sgom pa 'dis sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams ngi ltar bzhud pa de ltar gshegs shing sangs rgyas pas na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarbba ta th'a ga t'a tasta th'a aa ham zhes bya ba'i sgom pa 'dis sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams ngi ltar bzhud pa de ltar gshegs shing sangs rgyas pas na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: he went as the former Buddhas had, and became a Buddha, by this meditation: “Om, I am the Tathagata of all things.”

original: bdud bzhi'i dgra bcom pas na dgra bcom pa'o ;
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i dgra bcom pas na dgra bcom pa'o ;
translated: He is an Arhat because he has destroyed the four demons.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par kun nas thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa rgyud pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur to zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par kun nas thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa rgyud pas na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur to zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the Perfectly Awakened One, because he is the one who has perfectly and unerringly realized and awakened to reality.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus par gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus par gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that he is the essence of Vairocana, who is the condensation of all the Buddhas into one.

original: gdul bya'i ngor mdzad nas byin gyis brlabs pa ji ltar mdzad pa ltar dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: In order to show that the consecration and so forth should be done in the same way as the blessing was done in accordance with the disciples,

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: then the Bhagavān Vairocana, the Great Radiance,🔽the Vajra Body, Speech, and Mind of all Tathāgatas,🔽the One Gone to Bliss,🔽the One with the Nature of the Vajra of all Tathāgatas,🔽the One with the Nature of the Vajra of the Body, Speech, and Mind of all Tathāgatas,🔽the One with the Nature of the Vajra of the Body, Speech, and Mind of all Buddhas,
