original: badzra ratna zhes bya ba'i snying po 'dis rdo rje ri na chen gyi cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: badzra ratna zhes bya ba'i snying po 'dis rdo rje ri na chen gyi cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: With the essence mantra vajra ratna, he is consecrated with the diadem of the great vajra mountain.

original: kun du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po chos kyi ye shes ni bskyed ces bya ba la spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: kun du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po chos kyi ye shes ni bskyed ces bya ba la spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni bshad zin to //
translated: The Dharma knowledge of Avalokiteśvara is generated means that Avalokiteśvara has already been explained.

original: de'i chos ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po bstan pa dang rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: de'i chos ni ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dang / rnam par snang mdzad chen po bstan pa dang rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i yul lo //
translated: His Dharma is the object of emanation of the maṇḍala, such as Vairocana and Mahāvairocana as explained, Vajrasattva, and so on.

original: de'i ye shes ni nges pa ste de bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni nges pa ste de bskyed pa'o //
translated: His knowledge is certainty, which is generated.

original: 'di skad du ston te dbang bskur nas mdor na 'jig rten thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su gnang ba lnga po dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo la 'jug pa'i phyir byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du ston te dbang bskur nas mdor na 'jig rten thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su gnang ba lnga po dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo la 'jug pa'i phyir byin pa'o //
translated: This is taught: Having been consecrated, in brief, the five permissions beginning with 'in all worlds' and so on are given for the sake of entering the maṇḍala and entering the wheel of Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad la rab tu bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad la rab tu bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having thus established all the Tathagatas in all their activities,

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho gas 'gro ba'i don bya ba ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho gas 'gro ba'i don bya ba ni /
translated: the performance of the welfare of the world by the rite of drawing the mandala,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad de /
translated: is the activity of all the Tathagatas.

original: dbang bskur ba dang rjes su gnang ba byin nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las la 'jug par @43b bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang rjes su gnang ba byin nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i las la 'jug par @43b bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: Having conferred the consecration and given the authorization, one should engage in the rite of drawing the mandala.

original: de ltar mdzad nas de rnams kyi ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de ltar mdzad nas de rnams kyi ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: Having done so, what do they do?

original: ri rab kyi rtse mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ri rab kyi rtse mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning with “on the peak of Mount Meru” states:

original: khang pa brtsegs pa ni gtso bo'i bzhugs gnas kyi gzhal yas khang ngo //
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa ni gtso bo'i bzhugs gnas kyi gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: The palace is the celestial mansion, the abode of the principal deity.

original: rtse mo ni steng gi cha'o //
analyzed: rtse mo ni steng gi cha'o //
translated: The peak is the upper part.

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa'o /
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa'o /
translated: The vajra is the five-pronged vajra.

original: nor bu ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu ste /
analyzed: nor bu ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu ste /
translated: The jewel is the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: de dag ni rtse mo rdo rje dang nor bu rin po che las byas pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rtse mo rdo rje dang nor bu rin po che las byas pa ste /
translated: Those are made of the vajra and jewel peak.

original: des khang pa brtsegs pa'i rtse mo brgyan pa gang yin pa de ni khang pa brtsegs pa rtse mo rdo rje dang nor bu rin po che las byas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des khang pa brtsegs pa'i rtse mo brgyan pa gang yin pa de ni khang pa brtsegs pa rtse mo rdo rje dang nor bu rin po che las byas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which adorns the peak of the palace is called the peak of the palace made of the vajra and jewel gems.

original: de gang na ba der gshegs te byon nas zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: de gang na ba der gshegs te byon nas zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: Having gone there, he arrived.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po'i skur byin gyis brlabs pas zhal bzhi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po'i skur byin gyis brlabs pas zhal bzhi bskyed pa'o //
translated: Having blessed all the Tathagatas, means that by blessing the bodies of the four Tathagatas, Akshobhya and so forth, he generated the four faces.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan la zhes bya pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i lus seng ger gyur pa'i gdan de la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan la zhes bya pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i lus seng ger gyur pa'i gdan de la'o //
translated: On the lion seat of all the Tathagatas, means on the seat of the lion body of the Bodhisattva, by the power of the former prayers of all the Tathagatas.

original: zhal kun du bstan nas zhes bya ba ni zhal bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zhal kun du bstan nas zhes bya ba ni zhal bzhi pa'o //
translated: Facing all directions, means the four faces.

original: bzhag par gyur to zhes bya ba ni so sor gnas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bzhag par gyur to zhes bya ba ni so sor gnas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He was seated, means that he was placed, that is, he remained in each of the four directions.

original: zhal kun du bstan pa zhes bya ba zhal mtha' yas pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: zhal kun du bstan pa zhes bya ba zhal mtha' yas pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: The face that is turned everywhere is the infinite face.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las rnam par snang mdzad zhal bzhi par bri'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las rnam par snang mdzad zhal bzhi par bri'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: But that is not so, because the Root Tantra says, Draw Vairochana with four faces.

original: zhal bzhi po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: zhal bzhi po 'di dag ni /
translated: These four faces

original: byang chub kyi sems dang / sbyin pa dang / shes rab dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo mi bskyod pa la sogs par ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang / sbyin pa dang / shes rab dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo mi bskyod pa la sogs par ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: indicate Akshobhya and so forth, who are the essences of the perfections of the thought of enlightenment, generosity, wisdom, and effort.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du bdag nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du bdag nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Having blessed himself as all the Tathagatas,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyogs bzhir bzhugs so zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyogs bzhir bzhugs so zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: he sat in the four directions of the Lord.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bzhag par gyur ba'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bzhag par gyur ba'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: The word then refers to the immediate aftermath of the establishment of all the Tathagatas.

original: sngar grub pa rnams kyi sa bcom ldan 'das byin gyis brlabs nas seng ge'i gdan gang yin pa la bzhag par gyur pa des na thun mong du sems can thams cad kyi @44a * //
analyzed: sngar grub pa rnams kyi sa bcom ldan 'das byin gyis brlabs nas seng ge'i gdan gang yin pa la bzhag par gyur pa des na thun mong du sems can thams cad kyi @44a * //
translated: The Bhagavān blessed the seats of the previously accomplished buddhas and placed them on the lion throne.

original: don mdzad pa yin la /
analyzed: don mdzad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, he acts for the benefit of all sentient beings in common.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa yang de'i byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de'i yan lag tu gyur pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa yang de'i byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de'i yan lag tu gyur pa nyid yin te /
translated: Akshobhya and so on are also the essence of his bodhichitta and so on, and therefore they are his limbs.

original: de med par mi 'byung bas de rnams kyang rang la byin gyis brlab pa mdzad nas bzhugs so //
analyzed: de med par mi 'byung bas de rnams kyang rang la byin gyis brlab pa mdzad nas bzhugs so //
translated: Since they do not arise without him, they also exist by his blessing.

original: gal te de rnams de'i ngo bo nyid yin na de rnams kyi byin gyis brlab pa yang rnam par snang mdzad nyid kyis mdzad pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de rnams de'i ngo bo nyid yin na de rnams kyi byin gyis brlab pa yang rnam par snang mdzad nyid kyis mdzad pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If they are his essence, then his blessing is also done by Vairochana himself.

original: byin gyis brlab pa nyid kyang de rnams kyis byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa nyid kyang de rnams kyis byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the blessing itself is done by them.

original: de lta bas na de rnams rang nyid kyis mdzad pa yin no zhe na slob dpon gyis byin gyis brlabs su zin kyang nyin re zhing rang la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas nas bzlas pa dang bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don nyid yin no
analyzed: de lta bas na de rnams rang nyid kyis mdzad pa yin no zhe na slob dpon gyis byin gyis brlabs su zin kyang nyin re zhing rang la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas nas bzlas pa dang bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don nyid yin no
translated: The master, even though he has been consecrated, should perform the consecration of himself each day and so forth, and should recite and meditate.

original: // mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pas mi bskyod pas na mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: // mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pas mi bskyod pas na mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Akshobhya is so called because he is unshaken by the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: He is the nature of the character of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: 'di yod na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rin po che rnams dang / rin po che'i rigs 'byung bas na rin chen 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yod na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rin po che rnams dang / rin po che'i rigs 'byung bas na rin chen 'byung ba ste /
translated: Ratna-sambhava is so called because when he is present, the jewels of the seven members of enlightenment, the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so forth, and the jewel family arise.

analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni kun rdzob tu zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: His pledge is the manner of the moon-disk, etc., in the relative sense.

original: de las byung ba ni sems dpa' rdo rje ste thugs las byung nas sems dpa'i rdo rje'i rnam par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni sems dpa' rdo rje ste thugs las byung nas sems dpa'i rdo rje'i rnam par gyur pa'o //
translated: Arisen from that is the sattva-vajra, who, having arisen from the mind, becomes the form of a sattva-vajra.

original: de'i byin gyi rlabs ni brtan par bya ba'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sprul pa'i don du brtan par bya ba'i @46a * //
analyzed: de'i byin gyi rlabs ni brtan par bya ba'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sprul pa'i don du brtan par bya ba'i @46a * //
translated: His blessing is the firm establishment of the moon-disk, etc., for the sake of the emanation of the moon-disk, etc.

original: phyir rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par 'phrul pa lta bu thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par 'phrul pa lta bu thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the sake of firm establishment, he entered the meditative absorption that is like a vajra, indivisible, and then, having entered that meditative absorption, he made the mind one-pointed, like the emanation of Vajrasattva in the form of a moon-disk, etc. This is the meaning.

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas de ci zhig mdzad ce na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas de ci zhig mdzad ce na / de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What does he do after entering into such a samadhi?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi theg pa chen po yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi theg pa chen po yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The phrase “the great vehicle of all the Tathagatas” means that it is the great vehicle of all the Tathagatas because it is the great vehicle of all the Tathagatas.

original: de'i mngon par rtogs pa ni thugs su chud pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i mngon par rtogs pa ni thugs su chud pa yin la /
translated: The realization of that is the understanding of that.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa badzra satva zhes bya ba'i sgra'i tshul la yang nye bar gdags pas theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa badzra satva zhes bya ba'i sgra'i tshul la yang nye bar gdags pas theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: It is also figuratively designated as the method of the sound “vajrasattva,” which is the cause of that. Thus, it is explained as the sound “realization of the great vehicle.”

original: de nyid ni de'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid ni de'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That is taught by the phrase “that itself is the great vehicle of all the Tathagatas,” and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po de nyid kyi thugs ka nas phyung ste zhes bya ba ste ston par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po de nyid kyi thugs ka nas phyung ste zhes bya ba ste ston par gyur pa'o //
translated: The heart of all the Tathagatas, called the Realization of All the Tathagatas, was brought forth from his heart, that is, was taught.

original: badzra satva zhes bya ba 'di nyid rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i tshul gyis sgra la yang snying po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: badzra satva zhes bya ba 'di nyid rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i tshul gyis sgra la yang snying po zhes bshad do //
translated: This very [mantra] Vajrasattva is called the heart in the sense of the result being figuratively designated to the cause.

original: bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po de nyid ces bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po de nyid ces bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs so //
translated: That very Bhagavat Samantabhadra is the one who was previously taught as the form of Vajrasattva.

original: sems can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs su gyur pa la mngon par dga' ba de rnams la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs su gyur pa la mngon par dga' ba de rnams la /
translated: With regard to all sentient beings, etc., those who are all sentient beings in the ten directions who have become the families of all the Tathagatas beginning with Vajrasattva, they delight in that.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ye shes bskyed pa ni byang chub kyi sems chen po yang dag par sbyangs pa yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ye shes bskyed pa ni byang chub kyi sems chen po yang dag par sbyangs pa yin te /
translated: The generation of the wisdom of Vajrasattva is the purification of the great mind of enlightenment.

original: byang chub chen po las phyir mi ldog par de rnams kyi sems mdzad nas /
analyzed: byang chub chen po las phyir mi ldog par de rnams kyi sems mdzad nas /
translated: Having made their minds irreversible from great enlightenment,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyogs phyogs su 'khod do zhes bya ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams na lha'i gnas rnams yod pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyogs phyogs su 'khod do zhes bya ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams na lha'i gnas rnams yod pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: they are situated in the directions of all the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa @46b thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa @46b thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge vajra of all the Tathagatas is

original: byang chub kyi sems ston par byed pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa ni ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ston par byed pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa ni ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: the five-pronged knowledge vajra that teaches the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs kar zhugs te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs kar zhugs te /
translated: And they, having entered into the heart of the Lord Vairocana,

original: rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs su gyur to //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs su gyur to //
translated: became the form of a five-pronged vajra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Vajrasattva” and so on.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The samadhi of Vajrasattva is the samadhi of Vajrasattva.

original: bcom ldan sems dpa' de nyid ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan sems dpa' de nyid ni //
translated: The Lord himself is the Bodhisattva

original: thugs kar rdo rje bsgom pa yis //
analyzed: thugs kar rdo rje bsgom pa yis //
translated: By meditating on the vajra at the heart,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bshad do //
translated: one is explained as Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje der ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje der ni rab tu gnas //
translated: The vajra is well-established there,

original: zhes lung las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes lung las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: as stated in the scriptures.

original: de nyid shin tu brtan pa nyid ni mang po'i gzugs su gcig tu gyur par shin tu yang yongs su bsgoms pa nyid kyis rdo rje gcig gi gzugs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid shin tu brtan pa nyid ni mang po'i gzugs su gcig tu gyur par shin tu yang yongs su bsgoms pa nyid kyis rdo rje gcig gi gzugs su gyur pa'o //
translated: That very stability is the transformation into the form of a single vajra through thorough meditation as a single one among many forms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis kyang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis kyang gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa ste /
translated: And through the blessing of all the Tathagatas, it becomes a single unified whole.

original: mi phyed pa'o /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'o /
translated: It is indivisible.

original: tshad ji tsam zhe na ;
analyzed: tshad ji tsam zhe na ;
translated: What is its size?

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, as vast as space, and so forth.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du kun nas mnyam par 'jug par 'gro ba'i rdo rje'i gzugs kyis khyab par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du kun nas mnyam par 'jug par 'gro ba'i rdo rje'i gzugs kyis khyab par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The vajra form that pervades everywhere, as vast as the realm of space, becomes a single unified whole.

original: gang la nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad dang mnyam par 'jug pa'i tshad yod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad dang mnyam par 'jug pa'i tshad yod pa de ni /
translated: That which has the extent of being as vast as the realm of space

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi tshad dang mnyam par 'jug pa'o //🔽'od zer gyi phreng ba can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi tshad dang mnyam par 'jug pa'o // 'od zer gyi phreng ba can zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the same size as the realm of space.🔽The one called “Garland of Light Rays”

original: 'od zer rnams kyi phreng ba ni 'od zer gyi phreng ba ste /
analyzed: 'od zer rnams kyi phreng ba ni 'od zer gyi phreng ba ste /
translated: is the garland of light rays.

original: de 'di la yod pas na 'od zer gyi phreng ba can no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na 'od zer gyi phreng ba can no //
translated: Since it exists here, it is the Garland of Light Rays.

original: rtse mo lnga pa zhes bya ba ni rtse mo lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo lnga pa zhes bya ba ni rtse mo lnga pa'o //
translated: The one called “Five-Peaked” is the five-peaked.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas

original: de'i rgyu can nam de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can nam de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: is the cause of that or its nature.

original: byung ste phyag gnyis su gnas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byung ste phyag gnyis su gnas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having arisen, it abides in the two hands.

original: bsdus pa'i tshul gyis tshad gzhal du rung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshul gyis tshad gzhal du rung bar gyur te /
translated: Having become measurable in terms of size through the mode of condensation,

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs ka nas phyung nas rnam par mdzad kyi phyag gnyis su gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs ka nas phyung nas rnam par mdzad kyi phyag gnyis su gnas so //
translated: having emerged from the heart of Vairocana, it abides in the two hands of Vairocana.

original: rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The one called “Vajra-like” and so forth🔽is the vajra-like.

original: rdo rje de las rdo rje rtse lnga pa lta bu ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs can gyi 'od zer rnams byung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje de las rdo rje rtse lnga pa lta bu ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i gzugs can gyi 'od zer rnams byung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: From that vajra, vajra-like light rays in the form of five-pronged vajras emerge.

original: dbyibs ji lta bu kha dog ji lta bu zhe na /🔽gzugs dang zhes bya ba @47a * //
analyzed: dbyibs ji lta bu kha dog ji lta bu zhe na / gzugs dang zhes bya ba @47a * //
translated: What is their shape and what is their color?

original: la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said forms and so on.

original: gzugs ni dbyibs so //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbyibs so //
translated: Form is shape.

original: sna tshogs ni dbyibs mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni dbyibs mdzes pa'o //
translated: Variety is beautiful shape.

original: kha dog sna tshogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa ste /
translated: Various colors are blue and so on.

original: de lar gzugs sna tshogs pa dang kha dog sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lar gzugs sna tshogs pa dang kha dog sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has various forms and various colors is so-called.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang bas khyab par byed ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rang gi ngo bo yang dag par ston pa'i snang bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab par spros pa'i snang ba gang la yod pa de
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang bas khyab par byed ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rang gi ngo bo yang dag par ston pa'i snang bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab par spros pa'i snang ba gang la yod pa de
translated: It pervades all world systems with light, illuminating them, means that which has the light of manifesting its own nature pervading all world systems, emanating light.

original: ni / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bas khyab par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: ni / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bas khyab par byed pa'o ;
translated: They pervade all world systems with light.

original: / rdo rje lta bu'i 'od zer de dag gi rtse mo las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / rdo rje lta bu'i 'od zer de dag gi rtse mo las zhes bya ba la /
translated: From the tips of those vajra-like light rays,

original: 'od zer rnams kyi sgo ni 'od zer gyi rtse mo ste /
analyzed: 'od zer rnams kyi sgo ni 'od zer gyi rtse mo ste /
translated: the doors of the light rays are the tips of the light rays.

original: de rnams kyi mtha' ma'i tse mo'i cha'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtha' ma'i tse mo'i cha'o //
translated: They are the final tips of those.🔽From them, the bodies of the tathagatas equal to the atoms in all world systems arise.🔽The bodies of the tathagatas are the great seals of Vairochana and so forth.

original: de rnams las 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rdul shin tu phra mo snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku byung ste zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po byung zhing mthong nas /
analyzed: de rnams las 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rdul shin tu phra mo snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku byung ste zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po byung zhing mthong nas /
translated: Having arisen and been seen,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam rgya mtsho'i sprin thams cad du /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam rgya mtsho'i sprin thams cad du /
translated: in all the clouds of oceans of world systems

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bstan nas gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa las /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bstan nas gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa las /
translated: they teach the generation of the mind of enlightenment and so forth.🔽Having become one taste,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po'i skur gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po'i skur gyur te /
translated: they become the body of the great bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs la gnas nas ched du brjod pa 'dis ched du brjod do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs la gnas nas ched du brjod pa 'dis ched du brjod do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Having dwelled in the heart of the Transcendent Lord Vairocana, he uttered this utterance.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ji lta bu dag tu zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ji lta bu dag tu zhe na /
translated: In what kind of world systems?

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says the realm of phenomena, and so on.

original: phyogs bcu'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis ma lus bar chos kyi dbyings yin pas chos kyi dbyings thams cad de /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis ma lus bar chos kyi dbyings yin pas chos kyi dbyings thams cad de /
translated: Since all phenomena in the ten directions are the realm of phenomena, without exception, in the manner of ultimate non-entityness, it is the entire realm of phenomena.

original: des kun du khyab pa ni de ltar 'jug pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: des kun du khyab pa ni de ltar 'jug pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which pervades that is so engaged is called that.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad de de rnams dang / nam mkha'i khams kyang yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad de de rnams dang / nam mkha'i khams kyang yin la /
translated: All oceans of world systems are that, and also the realm of space.

original: thams cad kyang yin pas na /
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin pas na /
translated: Since they are all,

original: nam mkha'i khams thams cad de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams thams cad de /
translated: they are the entire realm of space.

original: de nyid ni mthas gtugs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mthas gtugs pa ste /
translated: That itself is the limit.

original: yongs su mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'i khams thams cad kyi mthas gtugs @47b pa thams cad do //
analyzed: yongs su mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'i khams thams cad kyi mthas gtugs @47b pa thams cad do //
translated: That which is the ultimate limit is the limit of all the realms of space.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam rgya mtsho'i sprin thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam rgya mtsho'i sprin thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In all the clouds of oceans of world-spheres,

original: de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab 'byam ni rgyun rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rab 'byam ni rgyun rnams so //
translated: therein, the world-spheres are the oceans of world-spheres.

original: de rnams kyis bsdus pa nyid ni sprin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyis bsdus pa nyid ni sprin no //
translated: They are clouds because they are collected together.

original: de rnams kyis yang dag par bsdus pa ni rgya mtsho'o//
analyzed: de rnams kyis yang dag par bsdus pa ni rgya mtsho'o//
translated: They are oceans because they are collected together by them.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams mtha' yas pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams mtha' yas pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows the infinity of the world-spheres.

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa sems can rnams la ston par mdzad ce na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa sems can rnams la ston par mdzad ce na / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: How does he teach beings the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, etc.?🔽He teaches the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ma nyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ma nyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni //
translated: The knowledge of the non-duality of all the Tathāgatas is the knowledge of the non-duality of all the Tathāgatas.

original: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshul chos kyi dbyings su ro gcig ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshul chos kyi dbyings su ro gcig ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom of the indivisible method and wisdom, which is of one taste in the dharmadhatu.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par shes pa ni drug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par shes pa ni drug ste /
translated: The superknowledges of all tathagatas are six:

original: lha'i spyan dang / lha'i snyan dang / gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dgongs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: lha'i spyan dang / lha'i snyan dang / gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dgongs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of others' minds, the recollection of past lives, miracles, and the wisdom of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mngon par shes pa 'di dag nyid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mngon par shes pa 'di dag nyid ni /
translated: The wisdom and superknowledges of all tathagatas are

original: mngon par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa ste /
translated: the manifest enlightenment.

original: 'di dag thugs su chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag thugs su chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi /
translated: By mastering these, the mind of all tathagatas

original: byang chub kyi sems chen po'i rang bzhin gyi thugs ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems chen po'i rang bzhin gyi thugs ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: is glorious Vajrasattva, the nature of the great mind of enlightenment.

original: de bskyed pa ni sgom pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: de bskyed pa ni sgom pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: The generation of that [mind] is for sentient beings who delight in meditation.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po mngon sum du byas pa'o//
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po mngon sum du byas pa'o//
translated: The great seal of Vajrasattva is actualized.

original: de yang rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dbang du mdzad nas byang chub kyi sems chen po zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dbang du mdzad nas byang chub kyi sems chen po zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: And that is explained as the great thought of enlightenment in the sense of the great seal of Vajrasattva.

original: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa sna tshogs pa ni 'jig rten gsum gyi tshul gyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa ste grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i spyod pa sna tshogs pa ni 'jig rten gsum gyi tshul gyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa ste grub pa'o //
translated: The various activities of Samantabhadra are the performance of the aims of sentient beings by the method of the three worlds, which is the accomplishment.

original: de yang ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po'i spyod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das kun du bzang po'i spyod pa yin zhe na /
translated: And how is that the activity of the Blessed One Samantabhadra?

original: snying stobs rdul dang mun pas kyang //
analyzed: snying stobs rdul dang mun pas kyang //
translated: Since sattva, rajas, and tamas

original: gang phyir sems can don 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang phyir sems can don 'gyur bas /
translated: are for the sake of sentient beings,

original: des na 'di ni kun du bzang //
analyzed: des na 'di ni kun du bzang //
translated: therefore this is Samantabhadra,

original: byang chub spyod pa'i rjes 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub spyod pa'i rjes 'dug pa'o //
translated: dwelling in the aftermath of the conduct of enlightenment.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs @48a* //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no // de bzhin gshegs @48a* //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: pa thams cad kyi rigs mnyes bar mdzad pa dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la /
analyzed: pa thams cad kyi rigs mnyes bar mdzad pa dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la /
translated: The satisfaction of all the Tathagatas is the satisfaction of all the Tathagatas.

original: rigs kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs so //
analyzed: rigs kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs so //
translated: Since it is also a family, it is the family of all the Tathāgatas.

original: de rnams mnyes par mdzad pa ni dbang du mdzad pa'o /
analyzed: de rnams mnyes par mdzad pa ni dbang du mdzad pa'o /
translated: The propitiation of those is the subjugation of them.

original: byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa dang bdud thams cad btul ba ni 'og min gyi gnas dang mi'i yul du'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa dang bdud thams cad btul ba ni 'og min gyi gnas dang mi'i yul du'o //
translated: The going to the site of enlightenment and the subjugation of all the demons is in the Akaniṣṭha realm and in the human realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyams pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyams pa nyid ni /
translated: The equality of all the Tathāgatas is

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa po dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: the freedom from the grasped and the grasper on the part of the mind and mental factors.

original: de nyid ni byang chub chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni byang chub chen po'o //
translated: That itself is the great enlightenment.

original: de'i mngon par byang chub pa ni mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i rim gyis 'og min dang mi'i yul du brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mngon par byang chub pa ni mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i rim gyis 'og min dang mi'i yul du brnyes pa'o //
translated: Its manifest enlightenment is the attainment of it by means of the five manifest enlightenments in the Akaniṣṭha realm and in the human realm.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The turning of the wheel of the true Dharma is

original: dam pa rnams kyi chos yin pas dam pa rnams kyi chos te /
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi chos yin pas dam pa rnams kyi chos te /
translated: the true Dharma of the holy ones.

original: lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: It has the nature of the scriptures and realizations.

original: de nyid gdul bya'i rgyud la 'pho ba'i tshul gyis na 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de nyid gdul bya'i rgyud la 'pho ba'i tshul gyis na 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is a wheel in the sense of its transmission to the mental continuum of the disciple.

original: de bskor ba ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de bskor ba ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is turned in the sense of the mandala, etc.

original: ji srid kyi sgras ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: ji srid kyi sgras ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: The word “as long as” includes other things such as the stages and perfections.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa rnams yongs su skyob cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa rnams yongs su skyob cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Completely protects the entire realm of sentient beings without exception” means

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad dang na song la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las bzlog pa ni kun nas yongs su skyob pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad dang na song la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las bzlog pa ni kun nas yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: that it completely protects all realms of sentient beings from the suffering of the lower realms, etc.

original: thams cad la phan pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i bde bar smin ba'i las la sbyar ba'o /
analyzed: thams cad la phan pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i bde bar smin ba'i las la sbyar ba'o /
translated: “ Benefits all” means that it engages in the activity of ripening future happiness.

original: thams cad bde ba ni tshe 'di nyid la myong ba'i lus kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad bde ba ni tshe 'di nyid la myong ba'i lus kyi bde ba'o //
translated: “ Happifies all” means the happiness of the body that is experienced in this very life.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ni dpal rdo rje sems dpas nges par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ni dpal rdo rje sems dpas nges par sbyar ba'o //
translated: “ The wisdom of all the Tathāgatas” is the definite application of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par shes pa ni gnas skabs 'dir dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par shes pa ni gnas skabs 'dir dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of all the Tathagatas is the superknowledge of glorious Vajrasattva in this context.

original: de nyid ni dam pa'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid ni dam pa'i dngos grub bo //
translated: That itself is the supreme attainment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang / dam pa'i dngos grub de rnams grub pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdzu @48b 'phrul dang cho 'phrul mtha' yas pa rnams rab tu bstan pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang / dam pa'i dngos grub de rnams grub pa la sogs pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdzu @48b 'phrul dang cho 'phrul mtha' yas pa rnams rab tu bstan pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is called the “accomplishment of the knowledge, superknowledge, and supreme attainment of all the Tathagatas,” and so forth, and the “display of the infinite miracles and magical manifestations of all the Tathagatas.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rdo rje rgyal po la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes dang mngon par shes pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rdo rje rgyal po la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes dang mngon par shes pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “and so forth” includes the knowledge and superknowledge of all the Tathagatas, such as Vajraraja and so forth.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Miracles are such things as traveling through space.

original: cho 'phrul ni mthu yang dag par ston pa ste /
analyzed: cho 'phrul ni mthu yang dag par ston pa ste /
translated: Magical manifestations are the display of power.

original: long pa rnams kyis mig 'thob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: long pa rnams kyis mig 'thob bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The blind obtain sight, and so on.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni kun du bzang po yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni kun du bzang po yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The samādhi of Vajrasattva is Samantabhadra, and so on.

original: 'di las kun nas bzang zhing dge ba 'di las 'tshe ba med pas ni kun du bzang po'i skur gyur pa ste /🔽de bas na kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: 'di las kun nas bzang zhing dge ba 'di las 'tshe ba med pas ni kun du bzang po'i skur gyur pa ste / de bas na kun du bzang po'o //
translated: This is because it is completely good and virtuous, and because there is no harm in this, it becomes the body of Samantabhadra.🔽Therefore, it is Samantabhadra.

original: de nyid kyi ngo bo ni kun du bzang po nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bo ni kun du bzang po nyid yin pa'o //
translated: Its very essence is Samantabhadra itself.

original: su'i zhe na rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: su'i zhe na rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Whose? The samādhi of Vajrasattva.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig tu mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po dun du bzang po'i sku ni rdo rje sems dpa'i sku ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig tu mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po dun du bzang po'i sku ni rdo rje sems dpa'i sku ste /
translated: The body of the great bodhisattva Samantabhadra, who unifies all the tathāgatas as explained, is the body of Vajrasattva.

original: de lta bu'i kun du bzang po grub pa dang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i kun du bzang po grub pa dang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The accomplishment of such Samantabhadra is the samādhi of Vajrasattva.

original: de grub par byed pa la thugs rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de grub par byed pa la thugs rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind in accomplishing that.

original: shin tu brtan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu brtan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of being very firm means

original: sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing mig yor lta bur snang ba'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid kyis yongs su bsdus pa'i phyir dang / dngos por 'dzin pas bskyod par mi nus pa ni shin tu brtan pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing mig yor lta bur snang ba'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid kyis yongs su bsdus pa'i phyir dang / dngos por 'dzin pas bskyod par mi nus pa ni shin tu brtan pa ste /
translated: because of being included in emptiness by the mode of appearance that is like an illusion and like a mirage, and because of not being able to be shaken by the apprehension of entities, it is very firm.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni shin tu brtan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni shin tu brtan pa nyid do //
translated: Its essence is very firm.

original: de ltar shin tu brtan zhing dngos por 'dzin pa dang bral ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu brtan zhing dngos por 'dzin pa dang bral ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because of being like that, very firm and free from the apprehension of entities,

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig tu gyur pa kun du bzang po'i sku gcig pu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig tu gyur pa kun du bzang po'i sku gcig pu'o //
translated: that kind of samādhi is the single body of the Buddha, the single body of Samantabhadra.

original: shin tu brtan pa dang gcig tu gyur pa nyid kyis gcig tu gyur pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad las gzhan pa dga' ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu brtan pa dang gcig tu gyur pa nyid kyis gcig tu gyur pa'o // bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad las gzhan pa dga' ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is single because of being very firm and single.🔽In order to teach that the Bhagavān is different from Vairocana,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “From the body of the Bhagavān Vairocana,” and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs kyi dbang nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs kyi dbang nyid kyis so //
translated: The Bhagavat Vairocana, by the power of his mind alone,

original: du ma'i tshul gyis bzhud pa dang byon par ston pa @49a * //
analyzed: du ma'i tshul gyis bzhud pa dang byon par ston pa @49a * //
translated: shows the way of going and coming in many ways.

original: ni thugs la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: ni thugs la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He enters into the mind.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang sems dbang du bya bar 'dod na 'di lta bur bsgom par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang sems dbang du bya bar 'dod na 'di lta bur bsgom par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: He teaches that if others also wish to bring the mind under control, they should meditate in this way.

original: chad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The verse beginning with “the exclamation”🔽is the exclamation.

original: ched kar nye bar brjod pas na ched du brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ched kar nye bar brjod pas na ched du brjod pa ste /
translated: It is an exclamation because it is uttered with a special intention.

original: gzhan gyis mi bskul bas rang sa ba'i yid kyis brjod cing smras pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi bskul bas rang sa ba'i yid kyis brjod cing smras pa'o //
translated: It is uttered and spoken by the mind that is not urged on by others.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: “Amazing!” is a word of wonder.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni bdag nyid do //
translated: “I” means “myself.”

original: rang nyi byung bas ba rang 'byung ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: rang nyi byung bas ba rang 'byung ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: “Self-arisen” means “arisen from oneself,” namely the Bhagavat Buddha.

original: sems dpa' brtan zhes bya ba ni mi byed pa'i sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' brtan zhes bya ba ni mi byed pa'i sems dpa'o //
translated: “The steadfast one” means the one with an unwavering mind.

original: gal te khyod sangs rgyas rnams kyi kun du bzang po yin pa la ngo mtshar ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te khyod sangs rgyas rnams kyi kun du bzang po yin pa la ngo mtshar ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If you are the universal good of the buddhas, what is so amazing about that?

original: de ni brtan phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni brtan phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The reason for that is stated, beginning with because it is stable, and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir ni rgyu gang gis so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ni rgyu gang gis so //
translated: Because means for what reason?

original: brtan pas lus min kyang zhes bya ba ni /🔽gnyis su med ba'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin du zun kyang /
analyzed: brtan pas lus min kyang zhes bya ba ni / gnyis su med ba'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin du zun kyang /
translated: It is not the body, because it is stable, and so forth.

original: sems dpa'i lus su zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems dpa'i lus su zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even though it is the nature of the nondual mind, it is the body of the Bodhisattva, and so forth.

original: sems dpa'i sku'i ngo bo ni sems dpa'i lus nyid do //🔽gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems dpa'i sku'i ngo bo ni sems dpa'i lus nyid do // gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of the body of the Bodhisattva is the very body of the Bodhisattva.

original: thob cing grub pa 'di ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: thob cing grub pa 'di ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: It is the attainment and accomplishment of this that is wondrous.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /🔽bdag ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gzugs med pa yin na ;
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te / bdag ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gzugs med pa yin na ;
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyi mthus gdul byas bdag gzugs kyi skur mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyi mthus gdul byas bdag gzugs kyi skur mthong ba yin no //
translated: I am the nature of nondual wisdom, which is formless, but due to the power of the momentum of previous impulsion, the disciples see me as a body of form.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po'i sku zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po'i sku zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: Then, the great bodhisattva Samantabhadra, and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ka nas zhas bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ka nas zhas bya ba ni /
translated: From the heart of the Bhagavān, and so forth.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs ka nas so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs ka nas so //
translated: from the heart of Vairocana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyan snga na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyan snga na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the presence of all the Tathagatas means

original: bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'i mdun na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'i mdun na'o //
translated: in the presence of the Lord Akshobhya.

original: bka' nod cing bzhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bka' nod cing bzhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They stood, waiting for the command means

original: bdag gis ci zhig bgyi zhes bka' nod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ci zhig bgyi zhes bka' nod par gyur pa'o //
translated: they stood, waiting for the command, “What shall we do?”🔽The Lord Vairocana, having the eyes of Vairocana,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi spyan ldan rnam par snang mdzad la mngon par phyogs na ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi spyan ldan rnam par snang mdzad la mngon par phyogs na ni /
translated: facing Vairocana,

original: 'di zhal gcig pa dang phyag gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di zhal gcig pa dang phyag gnyis pa yin te /
translated: is one-faced and two-armed.

original: zhal du ma'i tshig med do //
analyzed: zhal du ma'i tshig med do //
translated: There is no mention of many faces.

original: gan gyang zhal du ma mnga' ba der ni khyad par nyid du gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gan gyang zhal du ma mnga' ba der ni khyad par nyid du gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of one who has many faces, it would be stated as a special feature.

original: de nas zhes bya ba @49b la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba @49b la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ste /
translated: The Lord entered into the samadhi

original: rdo rje de de'i lag tu byin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje de de'i lag tu byin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and gave that vajra into his hand.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: The word “then”

original: de ma thag pa ston pa'i tshig ste gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa ston pa'i tshig ste gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: Immediately is a word indicating the present; immediately after the request.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One is Vairocana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag na gnas pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i rnam pa de nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag na gnas pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i rnam pa de nyid /
translated: The gnosis of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is the five-pointed vajra existing in the hand of the Blessed One Vairocana.

original: kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin yin pas na dam tshig rdo rje'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin yin pas na dam tshig rdo rje'o //
translated: It is the pledge vajra because it is the nature of the conventional.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba nyid kyis na kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis rdo rje de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba nyid kyis na kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis rdo rje de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: It is called that vajra by way of the conventional method because it is the natural outflow of the gnosis of all the Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang ming de skad ces bshad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang ming de skad ces bshad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained in order to teach that the meditative stabilization observing that vajra is also called by that name.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi dam tshig rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi dam tshig rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Having entered into the samadhi called “Vajra of the Pledge of the Wisdom of All Tathagatas,” he said this.

original: rdo rje rtse lnga pa sbyin pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad cis bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga pa sbyin pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad cis bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He concentrated his mind one-pointedly on the five-pronged vajra, the form of generosity.

original: rdo rje de ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje de ji lta bu zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What is that vajra like?🔽All Tathagatas’ morality, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims ni /
translated: All Tathagatas’ morality is the morality of all Tathagatas.

original: ji lta dus gsum mgon po rnams //
analyzed: ji lta dus gsum mgon po rnams //
translated: As it is said:🔽The nature of the morality of the Bodhisattva

original: byang chub tu ni nges mdzad pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa phas pham pa bcu bzhi las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: byang chub tu ni nges mdzad pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa phas pham pa bcu bzhi las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: is the morality of the Bodhisattva.🔽The morality of the Bodhisattva is the morality of all the Buddhas.🔽The morality of all the Buddhas is the morality of all beings.🔽The morality of all beings is the morality of the world.🔽The morality of the world is the morality of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
